62 dtype2prec = {torch.float: 1e-5,

67 # WARNING: If you add a new top-level test case to this file, you MUST
68 # update test/run_test.py to list it, otherwise it will NOT be run in
69 # CI.
70 
71 
72 # Used to run the same test with different tensor types
73 def repeat_test_for_types(dtypes):
74  def repeat_helper(f):
75  @wraps(f)
76  def call_helper(self, *args):
77  for dtype in dtypes:
78  if PY34:
79  with TestCase.subTest(self, dtype=dtype):
80  f(self, *args, dtype=dtype)
81  else:
82  f(self, *args, dtype=dtype)
83 
84  return call_helper
85  return repeat_helper
86 
87 
88 class PackedSequenceTest(TestCase):
89 
90  _type_by_name = {
91  'torch.DoubleTensor': (torch.DoubleTensor, 'double'),
92  'torch.FloatTensor': (torch.FloatTensor, 'float'),
93  # We leave out `'torch.HalfTensor': (torch.HalfTensor, 'half'),`
94  # because of an error in `pad_packed_sequence`
95  # > AttributeError: 'torch.HalfTensor' object has no attribute 'fill_'
96  'torch.LongTensor': (torch.LongTensor, 'long'),
97  'torch.IntTensor': (torch.IntTensor, 'int'),
98  'torch.ShortTensor': (torch.ShortTensor, 'short'),
99  'torch.CharTensor': (torch.CharTensor, 'char'),
100  'torch.ByteTensor': (torch.ByteTensor, 'byte'),
101  }
102 
103  def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
104  super(PackedSequenceTest, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
105  self.batch_size = 5
106  self.max_length = 6
107 
108  def _ordered_sequence(self, tensor_type):
109  """Create ordered list of random sequences"""
110  seqs = [tensor_type(random.randint(1, self.max_length))
111  for _ in range(self.batch_size)]
112  seqs = [s.random_(-128, 128) for s in seqs]
113  ordered = sorted(seqs, key=len, reverse=True)
114  return ordered
115 
116  def _padded_sequence(self, tensor_type):
117  """Create Tensor of random padded sequences"""
118  ordered = self._ordered_sequence(tensor_type)
119  lengths = list(map(len, ordered))
120  padded_tensor = rnn_utils.pad_sequence(ordered)
121  return padded_tensor, lengths
122 
123  def test_type_casts(self):
124  """Test type casting of `PackedSequence` against type casting of tensor"""
125  for _, (input_type, _) in self._type_by_name.items():
126  for expected_type_str, (_, cast_str) in self._type_by_name.items():
127  for enforce_sorted in [True, False]:
128  padded, lengths = self._padded_sequence(input_type)
129  packed = rnn_utils.pack_padded_sequence(
130  padded, lengths, enforce_sorted=enforce_sorted)
131  # Apply cast to `PackedSequence` instance and unpack
132  masked = getattr(packed, cast_str)()
133  unpacked, lengths_out = rnn_utils.pad_packed_sequence(masked)
134  self.assertEqual(unpacked.type(), expected_type_str)
135 
136  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
137  def test_cuda_mask(self):
138  for enforce_sorted in [True, False]:
139  tensor_type = torch.FloatTensor
140  cuda_type_str = 'torch.cuda.FloatTensor'
141  padded, lengths = self._padded_sequence(tensor_type)
142  packed = rnn_utils.pack_padded_sequence(
143  padded, lengths, enforce_sorted=enforce_sorted)
144  self.assertFalse(packed.is_cuda)
145  packed = packed.cuda()
146  self.assertTrue(packed.is_cuda)
147  unpacked, _ = rnn_utils.pad_packed_sequence(packed)
148  self.assertEqual(unpacked.type(), cuda_type_str)
149 
150  def test_wrong_order(self):
151  a = torch.ones(25, 300)
152  b = torch.ones(22, 300)
153  b_a = rnn_utils.pad_sequence([b, a])
154  self.assertRaises(
155  RuntimeError,
156  lambda: rnn_utils.pack_padded_sequence(b_a, [22, 25], enforce_sorted=True))
157 
158  def test_total_length(self):
159  padded, lengths = self._padded_sequence(torch.FloatTensor)
160  max_length = max(lengths)
161  packed = rnn_utils.pack_padded_sequence(padded, lengths)
162  # test ValueError if total_length < max_length
163  for total_length in (-1, 0, max_length - 1):
164  for batch_first in (True, False):
165  def err_fn():
166  rnn_utils.pad_packed_sequence(packed, batch_first=batch_first,
167  total_length=total_length)
168  self.assertRaisesRegex(ValueError,
169  r'Expected total_length to be at least the '
170  r'length of the longest sequence in input',
171  err_fn)
172  # test that pad_packed_sequence returns results of correct length
173  for batch_first in (True, False):
174  no_extra_pad, _ = rnn_utils.pad_packed_sequence(packed, batch_first=batch_first)
175  for total_length_delta in (0, 1, 8):
176  total_length = max_length + total_length_delta
177  unpacked, lengths_out = rnn_utils.pad_packed_sequence(packed, batch_first=batch_first,
178  total_length=total_length)
179  self.assertEqual(lengths, lengths_out)
180  self.assertEqual(unpacked.size(1 if batch_first else 0), total_length)
181  if total_length_delta == 0:
182  ref_output = no_extra_pad
183  elif batch_first:
184  extra_pad = no_extra_pad.new_zeros(self.batch_size, total_length_delta)
185  ref_output = torch.cat([no_extra_pad, extra_pad], 1)
186  else:
187  extra_pad = no_extra_pad.new_zeros(total_length_delta, self.batch_size)
188  ref_output = torch.cat([no_extra_pad, extra_pad], 0)
189  self.assertEqual(unpacked, ref_output)
190 
191  def test_to(self):
192  for enforce_sorted in (True, False):
193  padded, lengths = self._padded_sequence(torch.IntTensor)
194  a = rnn_utils.pack_padded_sequence(
195  padded, lengths, enforce_sorted=enforce_sorted).cpu()
196 
197  self.assertIs(a, a.to('cpu'))
198  self.assertIs(a, a.to('cpu', dtype=torch.int32))
199  self.assertEqual(a.long(), a.to(torch.int64))
200 
201  if torch.cuda.is_available():
202  for cuda in ['cuda', 'cuda:0' if torch.cuda.device_count() == 1 else 'cuda:1']:
203  b = a.cuda(device=cuda)
204  self.assertIs(b, b.to(cuda))
205  self.assertEqual(a, b.to('cpu'))
206  self.assertEqual(b, a.to(cuda))
207  self.assertEqual(a, b.to('cpu', dtype=torch.int32))
208  self.assertIs(b, b.to(dtype=torch.int32))
209  self.assertEqual(b.long(), b.to(dtype=torch.int64))
210 
211 
212 def default_tensor_type(type):
213  type_str = torch.typename(type)
214 
215  def decorator(fn):
216  @wraps(fn)
217  def wrapper(*args, **kwargs):
218  old_type = torch.Tensor().type()
219  torch.set_default_tensor_type(type_str)
220  try:
221  return fn(*args, **kwargs)
222  finally:
223  torch.set_default_tensor_type(old_type)
224 
225  return wrapper
226 
227  return decorator
228 
229 
230 def _assertGradAndGradgradChecks(test_case, apply_fn, inputs):
231  # call assert function rather than returning a bool since it's nicer
232  # if we get whether this failed on the gradcheck or the gradgradcheck.
233  test_case.assertTrue(gradcheck(apply_fn, inputs))
234  test_case.assertTrue(gradgradcheck(apply_fn, inputs))
235 
236 
237 class InputVariableMixin(object):
238  def _get_input(self):
239  input = TestBase._get_input(self, False)
240 
241  def map_variables(i):
242  if isinstance(i, torch.Tensor):
243  if i.is_floating_point():
244  i.requires_grad = True
245  return i
246  else:
247  return type(i)(map_variables(elem) for elem in i)
248 
249  return map_variables(input)
250 
251 
252 class NewModuleTest(InputVariableMixin, ModuleTest):
253  def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
254  super(NewModuleTest, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
255  self.cudnn = kwargs.get('cudnn', False)
256  self.check_inplace = kwargs.get('check_inplace', False)
257  self.check_gradgrad = kwargs.get('check_gradgrad', True)
258  self.skip_double = kwargs.get('skip_double', False)
259 
260  def _do_test(self, test_case, module, input):
261  test_case.check_jacobian(module, input, self.jacobian_input)
262 
263  if self.check_gradgrad:
264  # could probably unify check_jacobian above with this.
265  params = tuple(x for x in module.parameters())
266  _assertGradAndGradgradChecks(test_case,
267  lambda x, *args, **kw: test_case._forward(module, x), (input,) + params)
268 
269  # check if module can be printed
270  module.__repr__()
271 
272  if self.check_inplace:
273  # check if the inplace variant of the module gives the same result
274  # as the out-of-place
275 
276  module_ip = self.constructor(*self.constructor_args, inplace=True)
277 
278  input_version = input._version
279  with freeze_rng_state():
280  output = module(input)
281  test_case.assertEqual(input._version, input_version)
282 
283  input_ip = deepcopy(input)
284  input_ip_clone = input_ip.clone()
285  with freeze_rng_state():
286  output_ip = module_ip(input_ip_clone)
287  test_case.assertNotEqual(input_ip_clone._version, input_version)
288  test_case.assertEqual(output, output_ip)
289  grad = output.data.clone().normal_()
290  input.grad.data.zero_()
291  output.backward(grad)
292  output_ip.backward(grad)
293  test_case.assertEqual(input.grad, input_ip.grad)
294 
295  if isinstance(input, torch.LongTensor) and TEST_CUDA:
296  # check that cuda() moves module parameters to correct GPU device,
297  # and that float() casts parameters correctly
298 
299  input = input.cuda()
300  module.float().cuda()
301  module(input)
302  for p in module.parameters():
303  test_case.assertIsInstance(p, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)
304  test_case.assertEqual(p.get_device(), 0)
305 
306  if torch.cuda.device_count() > 1:
307  input = input.cuda(1)
308  module.cuda(1)
309  with torch.cuda.device(1):
310  module(input)
311  for p in module.parameters():
312  test_case.assertIsInstance(p, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)
313  test_case.assertEqual(p.get_device(), 1)
314  else:
315  # check that float()/double() casters work correctly
316 
317  # to float
318  if not isinstance(input, torch.LongTensor):
319  input = input.float()
320  module.float()
321  module(input)
322  for p in module.parameters():
323  test_case.assertIsInstance(p, torch.FloatTensor)
324 
325  # and back to double
326  if not isinstance(input, torch.LongTensor):
327  input = input.double()
328  module.double()
329  module(input)
330  for p in module.parameters():
331  test_case.assertIsInstance(p, torch.DoubleTensor)
332 
333  if TEST_CUDA and self.should_test_cuda:
334  # check that cuda() moves module parameters to correct GPU device,
335  # and that float() casts parameters correctly
336 
337  # to GPU0
338  input = input.float().cuda()
339  module.float().cuda()
340  module(input)
341  for p in module.parameters():
342  test_case.assertIsInstance(p, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)
343  test_case.assertEqual(p.get_device(), 0)
344 
345  # to CPU
346  input = input.cpu()
347  module.cpu()
348  module(input)
349  for p in module.parameters():
350  test_case.assertIsInstance(p, torch.FloatTensor)
351 
352  # back to GPU0
353  input = input.cuda()
354  module.cuda()
355  module(input)
356  for p in module.parameters():
357  test_case.assertIsInstance(p, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)
358  test_case.assertEqual(p.get_device(), 0)
359 
360  # test that forwards of module runs correctly without cuDNN
361  if self.cudnn:
362  with torch.backends.cudnn.flags(enabled=False):
363  module(input)
364  for p in module.parameters():
365  test_case.assertIsInstance(p, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)
366  test_case.assertEqual(p.get_device(), 0)
367 
368  if torch.cuda.device_count() >= 2:
369  # test cross-GPU transfer works
370  # to GPU1
371  input = input.cuda(1)
372  module.cuda(1)
373  with torch.cuda.device(1):
374  module(input)
375  for p in module.parameters():
376  test_case.assertIsInstance(p, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)
377  test_case.assertEqual(p.get_device(), 1)
378 
379  if not self.skip_double:
380  # test double()
381  input = input.double().cuda()
382  module.double().cuda()
383  module(input)
384  for p in module.parameters():
385  test_case.assertIsInstance(p, torch.cuda.DoubleTensor)
386  test_case.assertEqual(p.get_device(), 0)
387 
388  # test half()
389  input = input.half().cuda()
390  module.half().cuda()
391  module(input)
392  for p in module.parameters():
393  test_case.assertIsInstance(p, torch.cuda.HalfTensor)
394  test_case.assertEqual(p.get_device(), 0)
395 
396  def _get_target(self):
397  return self._get_arg('target', False)
398 
399  @property
400  def constructor_args(self):
401  return self._get_arg('constructor_args', False)
402 
403 
404 class NewCriterionTest(InputVariableMixin, CriterionTest):
405  # TODO: check that criterions don't ignore grad_output
406 
407  def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
408  super(NewCriterionTest, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
409  self.check_gradgrad = kwargs.get('check_gradgrad', True)
410  self.check_half = kwargs.get('check_half', True)
411  self.convert_target = kwargs.get('convert_target', True)
412 
413  def _do_extra_tests(self, test_case, module, input, target):
414  if not self.check_gradgrad:
415  return
416 
417  test_case.assertFalse(target.requires_grad)
418 
419  params = tuple(x for x in module.parameters())
420  if not isinstance(input, tuple):
421  inputs = (input,) + params
422 
423  def apply_fn(input, *params):
424  return module(input, target)
425  else:
426  inputs = input + params
427 
428  def apply_fn(input1, input2, *params):
429  return module(input1, input2, target)
430 
431  # TODO: we don't pass `target` as part of inputs because we don't
432  # currently compute the gradient w.r.t. target for loss functions.
433  gradcheck(apply_fn, inputs)
434  gradgradcheck(apply_fn, inputs)
435 
436  def test_cuda(self, test_case, dtype=None, extra_args=None):
437  def convert_dtype(obj, dtype, requires_grad=False):
438  if isinstance(obj, torch.Tensor):
439  return obj.detach().to(dtype=dtype).requires_grad_(requires_grad)
440  elif isinstance(obj, torch.Tensor):
441  return obj.to(dtype)
442  elif isinstance(obj, tuple):
443  return tuple(convert_dtype(o, dtype, requires_grad) for o in obj)
444  else:
445  return obj
446 
447  if not TEST_CUDA or not self.should_test_cuda:
448  raise unittest.SkipTest('Excluded from CUDA tests')
449  try:
450  cpu_input = self._get_input()
451  cpu_target = self._get_target()
452  cpu_module = self.constructor(*self.constructor_args)
453  gpu_module = self.constructor(*self.constructor_args)
454 
455  # Convert input, target and module parameters to dtype
456  if dtype is not None:
457  cpu_input = convert_dtype(cpu_input, dtype, True)
458  # NLLLoss requires target to be LongTensor
459  if not isinstance(cpu_target, torch.LongTensor) and self.convert_target:
460  cpu_target = convert_dtype(cpu_target, dtype)
461  cpu_module.type(dtype)
462  gpu_module.type(dtype)
463 
464  # GPU setup
465  gpu_input = to_gpu(cpu_input)
466  gpu_target = to_gpu(cpu_target)
467  gpu_module.cuda()
468 
469  # torch.HalfTensor doesn't support most operations, converting back to default
470  if dtype == torch.half:
471  cpu_input = self._get_input()
472  cpu_target = self._get_target()
473  # Loss modules with weights require consistent input/module weight types
474  cpu_module = self.constructor(*self.constructor_args)
475 
476  cpu_output = test_case._forward_criterion(cpu_module, cpu_input, cpu_target, extra_args=extra_args)
477  gpu_output = test_case._forward_criterion(gpu_module, gpu_input, gpu_target, extra_args=extra_args)
478  # dtype can be None, so set precision in this way instead of a precision map
479  test_case.assertEqual(cpu_output, gpu_output, 1e-1 if dtype == torch.half else 4e-4)
480 
481  cpu_gradInput = test_case._backward_criterion(cpu_module, cpu_input, cpu_target, extra_args=extra_args)
482  gpu_gradInput = test_case._backward_criterion(gpu_module, gpu_input, gpu_target, extra_args=extra_args)
483  test_case.assertEqual(cpu_gradInput, gpu_gradInput, 1e-1 if dtype == torch.half else 4e-4)
484  except NotImplementedError:
485  pass
486 
487  def _get_target(self):
488  return self._get_arg('target', False)
489 
490  @property
491  def constructor_args(self):
492  return self._get_arg('constructor_args', False)
493 
494  @property
495  def extra_args(self):
496  return self._get_arg('extra_args', False)
497 
498 
499 class TestNN(NNTestCase):
500  _do_cuda_memory_leak_check = True
501 
502  def _forward(self, module, input):
503  with freeze_rng_state():
504  return module(input)
505 
506  def _backward(self, module, input, output, grad_output, create_graph=False):
507  output.backward(grad_output, retain_graph=True, create_graph=create_graph)
508  if input.grad is None:
509  return None
510  return input.grad.data
511 
512  def _forward_criterion(self, criterion, input, target, extra_args=None):
513  if extra_args is None:
514  extra_args = tuple()
515  if isinstance(input, tuple):
516  args = input + (target,) + extra_args
517  output = criterion(*args)
518  else:
519  output = criterion(input, target, *extra_args)
520  return output
521 
522  def _backward_criterion(self, criterion, input, target, gradOutput=None, extra_args=None):
523  if extra_args is None:
524  extra_args = tuple()
525  input_tuple = input if isinstance(input, tuple) else (input,)
526  for i in input_tuple:
527  if i.grad is not None:
528  i.grad.data.zero_()
529  args = input_tuple + (target,) + extra_args
530  if gradOutput is None:
531  gradOutput = torch.ones(())
532  criterion(*args).backward(gradOutput.type_as(input_tuple[0]))
533  if isinstance(input, tuple):
534  return tuple(map(lambda i: i.grad.data, input))
535  else:
536  return input.grad.data
537 
538  def _zero_grad_parameters(self, module):
539  for p in module.parameters():
540  if p.grad is not None:
541  with torch.no_grad():
542  p.grad.zero_()
543  p.grad.detach_()
544 
545  def _get_parameters(self, module):
546  params = []
547  d_params = []
548  for p in module.parameters():
549  params.append(p)
550  d_params.append(p.grad)
551  return params, d_params
552 
553  def _create_basic_net(self):
554  class Layer(nn.Module):
555  def __init__(self):
556  super(Layer, self).__init__()
557  self.layer_dummy_param = Parameter(torch.Tensor(3, 5))
558  self.register_buffer('layer_dummy_buf', torch.zeros(1, 3, 3, 7))
559 
560  class Net(nn.Module):
561  def __init__(self):
562  super(Net, self).__init__()
563  self.l1 = Layer()
564  self.dummy_param = Parameter(torch.Tensor(3, 5))
565  self.register_buffer('dummy_buf', torch.zeros(7, 3, 3, 1))
566 
567  l = Layer()
568  n = Net()
569  s = nn.Sequential(n, n)
570 
571  return l, n, s
572 
573  def test_module_backcompat(self):
574  from torch.serialization import SourceChangeWarning
575  path = download_file('https://download.pytorch.org/test_data/linear.pt')
576  with warnings.catch_warnings():
577  warnings.simplefilter('ignore', SourceChangeWarning)
578  m = torch.load(path)
579  input = torch.randn(2, 3, dtype=torch.float)
580  self.assertEqual(m(input).size(), (2, 5))
581 
582  def test_share_memory(self):
583  class Net(nn.Module):
584  def __init__(self):
585  super(Net, self).__init__()
586  self.p = nn.Parameter(torch.eye(5))
587  self.par = nn.ParameterList()
588  self.par.append(nn.Parameter(torch.randn(10)))
589 
590  def forward(self, inp):
591  # NB: dead code
592  return inp.clone()
593 
594  net = Net()
595  for p in net.parameters():
596  self.assertFalse(p.storage().is_shared())
597  for b in net.buffers():
598  self.assertFalse(b.storage().is_shared())
599  net.share_memory()
600  for p in net.parameters():
601  self.assertTrue(p.storage().is_shared())
602  for b in net.buffers():
603  self.assertTrue(b.storage().is_shared())
604 
605  def test_hooks(self):
606  module = nn.Sigmoid()
607  input = torch.ones(5, 5, requires_grad=True)
608 
609  counter = {
610  'forwards': 0,
611  'backwards': 0
612  }
613 
614  def fw_hook(inc, h_module, input, output):
615  self.assertIsInstance(input, tuple)
616  self.assertTrue(isinstance(output, torch.Tensor))
617  self.assertTrue(h_module is module)
618  self.assertEqual(input[0].data, torch.ones(5, 5))
619  self.assertEqual(output.data, torch.Tensor(5, 5).fill_(1 / (1 + 1 / math.e)))
620  counter['forwards'] += inc
621 
622  def bw_hook(inc, h_module, grad_input, grad_output):
623  self.assertIsInstance(grad_input, tuple)
624  self.assertIsInstance(grad_output, tuple)
625  self.assertTrue(h_module is module)
626  self.assertEqual(grad_output[0].data, torch.ones(5, 5) * 2)
627  counter['backwards'] += inc
628 
629  test_fwd = module.register_forward_hook(lambda *args: fw_hook(1, *args))
630 
631  module(input)
632  module(input)
633  self.assertEqual(counter['forwards'], 2)
634  self.assertEqual(counter['backwards'], 0)
635 
636  test_bwd = module.register_backward_hook(
637  lambda *args: bw_hook(1, *args))
638 
639  output = module(input)
640  self.assertEqual(counter['forwards'], 3)
641  self.assertEqual(counter['backwards'], 0)
642 
643  output.backward(torch.ones(5, 5) * 2, retain_graph=True)
644  self.assertEqual(counter['forwards'], 3)
645  self.assertEqual(counter['backwards'], 1)
646 
647  output.backward(torch.ones(5, 5) * 2, retain_graph=True)
648  self.assertEqual(counter['forwards'], 3)
649  self.assertEqual(counter['backwards'], 2)
650 
651  test2_fwd = module.register_forward_hook(lambda *args: fw_hook(2, *args))
652 
653  output = module(input)
654  self.assertEqual(counter['forwards'], 6)
655  self.assertEqual(counter['backwards'], 2)
656 
657  test2_bwd = module.register_backward_hook(lambda *args: bw_hook(2, *args))
658 
659  module(input).backward(torch.ones(5, 5) * 2)
660  self.assertEqual(counter['forwards'], 9)
661  self.assertEqual(counter['backwards'], 5)
662 
663  test2_bwd.remove()
664 
665  module(input).backward(torch.ones(5, 5) * 2)
666  self.assertEqual(counter['forwards'], 12)
667  self.assertEqual(counter['backwards'], 6)
668 
669  test2_fwd.remove()
670 
671  module(input).backward(torch.ones(5, 5) * 2)
672  self.assertEqual(counter['forwards'], 13)
673  self.assertEqual(counter['backwards'], 7)
674 
675  test_fwd.remove()
676  test_bwd.remove()
677 
678  def test_hook_cpp(self):
679  counter = [0]
680  bn = nn.BatchNorm1d(5)
681 
682  def hook(module, grad_inputs, grad_outputs):
683  counter[0] += 1
684  self.assertEqual(len(grad_inputs), 3)
685  self.assertEqual(len(grad_outputs), 1)
686  self.assertEqual(module, bn)
687 
688  bn.register_backward_hook(hook)
689  output = bn(torch.randn(5, 5, requires_grad=True))
690  output.sum().backward()
691 
692  def test_hook_fail(self):
693  module = nn.Sigmoid()
694  input = torch.randn(5, 5, requires_grad=True)
695 
696  def fw_fail1(self, input, output):
697  return output
698 
699  def fw_fail2(self, input, output):
700  return input
701 
702  def bw_fail1(self, grad_input, grad_output):
703  return grad_input[:-1]
704 
705  def bw_fail2(self, grad_input, grad_output):
706  return grad_input + (torch.randn(2, 2),)
707 
708  with module.register_forward_hook(fw_fail1):
709  with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError) as err:
710  module(input)
711  self.assertIn("fw_fail", err.exception.args[0])
712  self.assertIn("didn't return None", err.exception.args[0])
713 
714  with module.register_forward_hook(fw_fail2):
715  with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError) as err:
716  module(input)
717  self.assertIn("fw_fail2", err.exception.args[0])
718  self.assertIn("didn't return None", err.exception.args[0])
719 
720  with module.register_backward_hook(bw_fail1):
721  with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError) as err:
722  module(input).sum().backward()
723  self.assertIn("bw_fail", err.exception.args[0])
724  self.assertIn("got 0, but expected 1", err.exception.args[0])
725 
726  with module.register_backward_hook(bw_fail2):
727  with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError) as err:
728  module(input).sum().backward()
729  self.assertIn("bw_fail2", err.exception.args[0])
730  self.assertIn("got 2, but expected 1", err.exception.args[0])
731 
732  def test_hook_writeable(self):
733  module = nn.Linear(5, 5)
734  input = torch.randn(5, 5, requires_grad=True)
735 
736  def bw_hook(module, grad_input, grad_output):
737  for grad in grad_input:
738  self.assertTrue(isinstance(grad, torch.Tensor))
739  for grad in grad_output:
740  self.assertTrue(isinstance(grad, torch.Tensor))
741  return tuple(gi * 2 for gi in grad_input)
742 
743  module.register_backward_hook(bw_hook)
744  module(input).backward(torch.ones(5, 5))
745  expected_grad = torch.ones(5, 5).mm(module.weight.data) * 2
746  self.assertEqual(input.grad.data, expected_grad)
747 
748  def test_to(self):
749  m = nn.Linear(3, 5)
750  self.assertIs(m, m.to('cpu'))
751  self.assertIs(m, m.to('cpu', dtype=torch.float32))
752  self.assertEqual(m.double(), m.to(torch.float64))
753  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: m.to('cpu', copy=True))
754 
755  if torch.cuda.is_available():
756  for cuda in ['cuda', 'cuda:0' if torch.cuda.device_count() == 1 else 'cuda:1']:
757  m2 = m.cuda(device=cuda)
758  self.assertIs(m2, m2.to(cuda))
759  self.assertEqual(m, m2.to('cpu'))
760  self.assertEqual(m2, m.to(cuda))
761  self.assertIs(m2, m2.to(dtype=torch.float32))
762  self.assertEqual(m2.double(), m2.to(dtype=torch.float64))
763 
764  def test_zero_grad(self):
765  i = torch.randn(2, 5, requires_grad=True)
766  module = nn.Linear(5, 5)
767  for p in module.parameters():
768  p.requires_grad = False
769  module.zero_grad()
770 
771  module.weight.requires_grad = True
772  module.zero_grad()
773  self.assertIsNone(module.weight.grad) # uninitialized grad
774 
775  module(i).sum().backward()
776  self.assertIsNotNone(module.weight.grad)
777  self.assertGreater(module.weight.grad.data.abs().sum(), 0)
778  module.zero_grad()
779  self.assertEqual(module.weight.grad.data, module.weight.data.clone().zero_())
780 
781  module.bias.requires_grad = True
782  module.zero_grad()
783  self.assertIsNotNone(module.weight.grad)
784  self.assertIsNone(module.bias.grad)
785  module(i).sum().backward()
786  self.assertIsNotNone(module.weight.grad)
787  self.assertIsNotNone(module.bias.grad)
788  self.assertGreater(module.weight.grad.data.abs().sum(), 0)
789  self.assertGreater(module.bias.grad.data.abs().sum(), 0)
790  module.zero_grad()
791  self.assertEqual(module.weight.grad.data, module.weight.data.clone().zero_())
792  self.assertEqual(module.bias.grad.data, module.bias.data.clone().zero_())
793 
794  def test_no_grad(self):
795  module = nn.Conv2d(2, 5, kernel_size=3, padding=1)
796  input = torch.randn(1, 2, 10, 10)
797  x = input
798  y = input.clone()
799 
800  output = module(x)
801  self.assertTrue(output.requires_grad)
802  output.backward(torch.ones(1, 5, 10, 10))
803 
804  with torch.no_grad():
805  output2 = module(y)
806  self.assertFalse(output2.requires_grad)
807  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: output2.backward(torch.ones(1, 5, 10, 10)))
808 
809  def test_invalid_conv1d(self):
810  module = nn.Conv1d(in_channels=3, out_channels=33, kernel_size=10, stride=1, bias=True)
811  input = torch.randn(1, 3, 4)
812  with self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError,
813  r'Calculated padded input size per channel: \(4\). ' +
814  r'Kernel size: \(10\). Kernel size can\'t be greater than actual input size'):
815  module(input)
816 
817  # Negative stride check
818  module = nn.Conv1d(in_channels=3, out_channels=6, kernel_size=3, stride=-1, bias=True)
819  input = torch.randn(1, 3, 4)
820  with self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError, 'negative stride is not supported'):
821  module(input)
822 
823  def test_invalid_conv2d(self):
824  module = torch.nn.Conv2d(1, 1, kernel_size=3, dilation=2, stride=2)
825  input = torch.empty(1, 1, 4, 4)
826  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: module(input))
827 
828  module = nn.Conv2d(in_channels=3, out_channels=33, kernel_size=10, stride=1, bias=True)
829  input = torch.randn(1, 3, 1, 1)
830  with self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError,
831  r'Calculated padded input size per channel: \(1 x 1\). ' +
832  r'Kernel size: \(10 x 10\). Kernel size can\'t be greater than actual input size'):
833  module(input)
834 
835  # Negative stride check
836  module = nn.Conv2d(in_channels=3, out_channels=6, kernel_size=4, stride=-1, bias=True)
837  input = torch.randn(1, 3, 4, 4)
838  with self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError, 'negative stride is not supported'):
839  module(input)
840 
841  def test_invalid_conv3d(self):
842  module = torch.nn.Conv3d(1, 1, kernel_size=3, dilation=2, stride=2)
843  input = torch.empty(1, 1, 4, 4, 4)
844  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: module(input))
845 
846  # Negative stride check
847  module = torch.nn.Conv3d(1, 1, kernel_size=3, stride=-2)
848  input = torch.empty(1, 1, 4, 4, 4)
849  with self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError, 'negative stride is not supported'):
850  module(input)
851 
852  def _test_dropout(self, cls, cuda, input):
853  p = 0.2
854  device = torch.device("cuda") if cuda else torch.device("cpu")
855  input = input.to(device).fill_(1 - p)
856 
857  module = cls(p)
858  input_var = input.clone().requires_grad_()
859  output = module(input_var)
860  self.assertLess(abs(output.data.mean() - (1 - p)), 0.05)
861  output.backward(input)
862  self.assertLess(abs(input_var.grad.data.mean() - (1 - p)), 0.05)
863 
864  module = cls(p, True)
865  input_var = input.clone().requires_grad_()
866  output = module(input_var + 0)
867  self.assertLess(abs(output.data.mean() - (1 - p)), 0.05)
868  output.backward(input)
869  self.assertLess(abs(input_var.grad.data.mean() - (1 - p)), 0.05)
870 
871  # check eval mode doesn't change anything
872  for inplace in [True, False]:
873  module = cls(p, inplace).eval()
874  self.assertEqual(input, module(input))
875 
876  # Check that these don't raise errors
877  module.__repr__()
878  str(module)
879 
880  def _test_alpha_dropout(self, cls, input):
881  mean = input.mean()
882  std = input.std()
883 
884  for p in [0.2, 0.5, 0.8]:
885  module = cls(p)
886  input_var = input.detach().clone().requires_grad_()
887  output = module(input_var)
888  # output mean should be close to input mean
889  self.assertLess(abs(output.data.mean() - mean), 0.1)
890  # output std should be close to input std
891  self.assertLess(abs(output.data.std() - std), 0.1)
892  output.backward(input)
893 
894  def test_parameters_and_named_parameters(self):
895  def names(named_parameters):
896  return [k for k, _ in named_parameters]
897 
898  l, n, s = self._create_basic_net()
899 
900  self.assertEqual(len(list(l.parameters())), 1)
901  self.assertEqual(
902  names(l.named_parameters()),
903  ['layer_dummy_param'])
904 
905  self.assertEqual(len(list(n.parameters())), 2)
906  self.assertEqual(
907  names(n.named_parameters()),
908  ['dummy_param', 'l1.layer_dummy_param'])
909 
910  self.assertEqual(len(list(n.parameters(recurse=False))), 1)
911  self.assertEqual(
912  names(n.named_parameters(recurse=False)),
913  ['dummy_param'])
914 
915  self.assertEqual(len(list(s.parameters())), 2)
916  self.assertEqual(
917  names(s.named_parameters()),
918  ['0.dummy_param', '0.l1.layer_dummy_param'])
919 
920  def test_buffers_and_named_buffers(self):
921  def names(named_buffers):
922  return [k for k, _ in named_buffers]
923 
924  l, n, s = self._create_basic_net()
925 
926  self.assertEqual(len(list(l.buffers())), 1)
927  self.assertEqual(
928  names(l.named_buffers()),
929  ['layer_dummy_buf'])
930 
931  self.assertEqual(len(list(n.buffers())), 2)
932  self.assertEqual(
933  names(n.named_buffers()),
934  ['dummy_buf', 'l1.layer_dummy_buf'])
935 
936  self.assertEqual(len(list(n.buffers(recurse=False))), 1)
937  self.assertEqual(
938  names(n.named_buffers(recurse=False)),
939  ['dummy_buf'])
940 
941  self.assertEqual(len(list(s.buffers())), 2)
942  self.assertEqual(
943  names(s.named_buffers()),
944  ['0.dummy_buf', '0.l1.layer_dummy_buf'])
945 
946  def test_call_supports_python_dict_output(self):
947  class Net(nn.Module):
948  def __init__(self):
949  super(Net, self).__init__()
950  self.l1 = nn.Linear(10, 20)
951  self.register_backward_hook(self.hook)
952  self.check_backward_hook_flag = False
953 
954  def hook(self, module, grad_out, grad_in):
955  self.check_backward_hook_flag = True
956 
957  def forward(self, inputs):
958  return {"output": self.l1(inputs).sum()}
959 
960  net = Net()
961  model_output = net(torch.randn([5, 10]))
962  model_output["output"].backward()
963  self.assertTrue(net.check_backward_hook_flag)
964 
965  def test_children(self):
966  l1 = nn.Linear(2, 2)
967  l2 = nn.Linear(2, 2)
968  l3 = nn.Linear(2, 2)
969  l4 = nn.Linear(2, 2)
970  subnet = nn.Sequential(l3, l4)
971  s = nn.Sequential(l1, l2, l1, l2, subnet)
972  self.assertEqual(list(s.children()), [l1, l2, subnet])
973 
974  def test_dir(self):
975  linear = nn.Linear(2, 2)
976  linear._test_submodule = nn.Linear(2, 2)
977  linear._test_parameter = Parameter(torch.Tensor(2, 2))
978  linear.register_buffer('_test_buffer', torch.Tensor(2, 2))
979  keys = dir(linear)
980  self.assertIn('_test_submodule', keys)
981  self.assertIn('_test_parameter', keys)
982  self.assertIn('_test_buffer', keys)
983 
984  for key in keys:
985  self.assertTrue(hasattr(linear, key))
986 
987  def test_repr(self):
988  # no extra information or sub-modules
989  empty_sequential = nn.Sequential()
990  expected_repr_empty = 'Sequential()'
991  self.assertEqual(repr(empty_sequential), expected_repr_empty)
992 
993  # one liner extra information
994  linear = nn.Linear(1, 1)
995  expected_repr_linear = 'Linear(in_features=1, out_features=1, bias=True)'
996  self.assertEqual(repr(linear), expected_repr_linear)
997 
998  # sub-modules repr
999  sequential = nn.Sequential(linear)
1000  expected_repr_sequential = 'Sequential(\n' \
1001  ' (0): Linear(in_features=1, out_features=1, bias=True)\n' \
1002  ')'
1003  self.assertEqual(repr(sequential), expected_repr_sequential)
1004 
1005  def test_dir_digit(self):
1006  model = nn.Sequential(nn.Linear(2, 2))
1007  keys = dir(model)
1008  self.assertNotIn('0', keys)
1009 
1010  def test_named_children(self):
1011  l1 = nn.Linear(2, 2)
1012  l2 = nn.Linear(2, 2)
1013  l3 = nn.Linear(2, 2)
1014  l4 = nn.Linear(2, 2)
1015  subnet = nn.Sequential(l3, l4)
1016  s = nn.Sequential()
1017  with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
1018  s.add_module('', l1)
1019  with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
1020  s.add_module('name.with.dot', l1)
1021  s.add_module('layer1', l1)
1022  s.add_module('layer2', l2)
1023  s.add_module('layer3', l1)
1024  s.add_module('layer4', l2)
1025  s.add_module('subnet', subnet)
1026  self.assertEqual(list(s.named_children()), [('layer1', l1), ('layer2', l2), ('subnet', subnet)])
1027 
1028  def test_modules(self):
1029  class Net(nn.Module):
1030  def __init__(self):
1031  super(Net, self).__init__()
1032  self.l1 = l
1033  self.l2 = l
1034  self.param = torch.empty(3, 5)
1035 
1036  l = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1037  n = Net()
1038  s = nn.Sequential(n, n, n, n)
1039  self.assertEqual(list(s.modules()), [s, n, l])
1040 
1041  def test_named_modules(self):
1042  class Net(nn.Module):
1043  def __init__(self):
1044  super(Net, self).__init__()
1045  self.l1 = l
1046  self.l2 = l
1047  self.param = torch.empty(3, 5)
1048  self.block = block
1049  l = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1050  l1 = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1051  l2 = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1052  block = nn.Sequential()
1053  block.add_module('linear1', l1)
1054  block.add_module('linear2', l2)
1055  n = Net()
1056  s = nn.Sequential(n, n, n, n)
1057  self.assertEqual(list(s.named_modules()), [('', s), ('0', n), ('0.l1', l),
1058  ('0.block', block), ('0.block.linear1', l1),
1059  ('0.block.linear2', l2)])
1060 
1061  def test_register_buffer_raises_error_if_name_is_not_string(self):
1062  m = nn.Module()
1063  expected_error = 'buffer name should be a string. Got '
1064  with self.assertRaisesRegex(TypeError, expected_error + 'int'):
1065  m.register_buffer(1, torch.rand(5))
1066  with self.assertRaisesRegex(TypeError, expected_error + 'NoneType'):
1067  m.register_buffer(None, torch.rand(5))
1068 
1069  def test_register_buffer_raises_error_if_attr_exists(self):
1070  m = nn.Module()
1071  m.attribute_name = 5
1072  with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
1073  m.register_buffer('attribute_name', torch.rand(5))
1074 
1075  del m.attribute_name
1076  m.register_parameter('attribute_name', nn.Parameter())
1077  with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
1078  m.register_buffer('attribute_name', torch.rand(5))
1079 
1080  del m.attribute_name
1081  m.add_module('attribute_name', nn.Module())
1082  with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
1083  m.register_buffer('attribute_name', torch.rand(5))
1084 
1085  def test_register_buffer_raises_error_if_not_tensor(self):
1086  m = nn.Module()
1087  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1088  m.register_buffer('attribute_name', 5)
1089 
1090  def test_register_buffer_allows_overwriting_with_same_name(self):
1091  m = nn.Module()
1092  buffer1 = torch.rand(5)
1093  buffer2 = buffer1 + 5
1094  buffer3 = None
1095  m.register_buffer('buffer_name', buffer1)
1096  self.assertEqual(m.buffer_name, buffer1)
1097  m.register_buffer('buffer_name', buffer2)
1098  self.assertEqual(m.buffer_name, buffer2)
1099  m.register_buffer('buffer_name', buffer3)
1100  self.assertEqual(m.buffer_name, buffer3)
1101 
1102  def test_register_parameter_raises_error_if_name_is_not_string(self):
1103  m = nn.Module()
1104  expected_error = 'parameter name should be a string. Got '
1105  with self.assertRaisesRegex(TypeError, expected_error + 'int'):
1106  m.register_parameter(1, nn.Parameter())
1107  with self.assertRaisesRegex(TypeError, expected_error + 'NoneType'):
1108  m.register_parameter(None, nn.Parameter())
1109 
1110  def test_register_parameter_raises_error_if_attr_exists(self):
1111  m = nn.Module()
1112  m.attribute_name = 5
1113  with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
1114  m.register_parameter('attribute_name', nn.Parameter())
1115 
1116  del m.attribute_name
1117  m.register_buffer('attribute_name', torch.rand(5))
1118  with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
1119  m.register_parameter('attribute_name', nn.Parameter())
1120 
1121  del m.attribute_name
1122  m.add_module('attribute_name', nn.Module())
1123  with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
1124  m.register_parameter('attribute_name', nn.Parameter())
1125 
1126  def test_register_parameter_allows_overwriting_with_same_name(self):
1127  m = nn.Module()
1128  param1 = nn.Parameter(torch.rand(5))
1129  param2 = nn.Parameter(param1.data + 5)
1130  param3 = None
1131  m.register_parameter('param_name', param1)
1132  self.assertEqual(m.param_name, param1)
1133  m.register_parameter('param_name', param2)
1134  self.assertEqual(m.param_name, param2)
1135  m.register_parameter('param_name', param3)
1136  self.assertEqual(m.param_name, param3)
1137 
1138  def test_add_module_raises_error_if_attr_exists(self):
1139  m = nn.Module()
1140  m.attribute_name = 5
1141  with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
1142  m.add_module('attribute_name', nn.Module())
1143 
1144  del m.attribute_name
1145  m.register_buffer('attribute_name', torch.rand(5))
1146  with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
1147  m.add_module('attribute_name', nn.Module())
1148 
1149  del m.attribute_name
1150  m.register_parameter('attribute_name', nn.Parameter())
1151  with self.assertRaises(KeyError):
1152  m.add_module('attribute_name', nn.Module())
1153 
1154  def test_Sequential_getitem(self):
1155  l1 = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1156  l2 = nn.Linear(20, 30)
1157  l3 = nn.Linear(30, 40)
1158  l4 = nn.Linear(40, 50)
1159  n = nn.Sequential(l1, l2, l3, l4)
1160  self.assertIs(n[0], l1)
1161  self.assertIs(n[1], l2)
1162  self.assertIs(n[2], l3)
1163  self.assertIs(n[3], l4)
1164  self.assertIs(n[torch.tensor(3, dtype=torch.int64)], l4)
1165  self.assertEqual(n[1:], nn.Sequential(l2, l3, l4))
1166  self.assertEqual(n[3:], nn.Sequential(l4))
1167  self.assertEqual(n[:-1], nn.Sequential(l1, l2, l3))
1168  self.assertEqual(n[:-3], nn.Sequential(l1))
1169  self.assertEqual(n[::-1], nn.Sequential(l4, l3, l2, l1))
1170 
1171  def test_Sequential_setitem(self):
1172  l1 = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1173  l2 = nn.Linear(20, 30)
1174  l3 = nn.Linear(30, 40)
1175  l4 = nn.Linear(40, 50)
1176  n = nn.Sequential(l1, l2, l3)
1177  n[0] = l4
1178  n[-1] = l4
1179  n[torch.tensor(1, dtype=torch.int16)] = l1
1180  self.assertIs(n[0], l4)
1181  self.assertIs(n[1], l1)
1182  self.assertIs(n[2], l4)
1183 
1184  def test_Sequential_setitem_named(self):
1185  l1 = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1186  l2 = nn.Linear(20, 30)
1187  l3 = nn.Linear(30, 40)
1188  l4 = nn.Linear(40, 50)
1189  n = nn.Sequential(OrderedDict([
1190  ('linear1', l1),
1191  ('linear2', l2),
1192  ('linear3', l3),
1193  ]))
1194 
1195  n[0] = l4
1196  n[-1] = l4
1197  self.assertEqual(n.linear1, l4)
1198  self.assertEqual(n.linear3, l4)
1199 
1200  def test_Sequential_delitem(self):
1201  l1 = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1202  l2 = nn.Linear(20, 30)
1203  l3 = nn.Linear(30, 40)
1204  l4 = nn.Linear(40, 50)
1205  n = nn.Sequential(l1, l2, l3, l4)
1206  del n[-1]
1207  self.assertEqual(n, nn.Sequential(l1, l2, l3))
1208  del n[1::2]
1209  self.assertEqual(n, nn.Sequential(l1, l3))
1210 
1211  def test_ModuleList(self):
1212  modules = [nn.ReLU(), nn.Linear(5, 5)]
1213  module_list = nn.ModuleList(modules)
1214 
1215  def check():
1216  self.assertEqual(len(module_list), len(modules))
1217  for m1, m2 in zip(modules, module_list):
1218  self.assertIs(m1, m2)
1219  for m1, m2 in zip(modules, module_list.children()):
1220  self.assertIs(m1, m2)
1221  for i in range(len(modules)):
1222  self.assertIs(module_list[i], modules[i])
1223 
1224  check()
1225  modules += [nn.Conv2d(3, 4, 3)]
1226  module_list += [modules[-1]]
1227  check()
1228  modules.insert(1, nn.Linear(3, 2))
1229  module_list.insert(1, modules[1])
1230  check()
1231  modules.append(nn.Tanh())
1232  module_list.append(modules[-1])
1233  check()
1234  next_modules = [nn.Linear(5, 5), nn.Sigmoid()]
1235  modules.extend(next_modules)
1236  module_list.extend(next_modules)
1237  check()
1238  modules[2] = nn.Conv2d(5, 3, 2)
1239  module_list[2] = modules[2]
1240  check()
1241  modules[-1] = nn.Conv2d(5, 2, 1)
1242  module_list[-1] = modules[-1]
1243  check()
1244  idx = torch.tensor(2, dtype=torch.int32)
1245  modules[2] = nn.Conv2d(5, 3, 2)
1246  module_list[idx] = modules[2]
1247  self.assertIs(module_list[idx], modules[2])
1248  check()
1249  self.assertEqual(module_list[1:], nn.ModuleList(modules[1:]))
1250  self.assertEqual(module_list[3:], nn.ModuleList(modules[3:]))
1251  self.assertEqual(module_list[:-1], nn.ModuleList(modules[:-1]))
1252  self.assertEqual(module_list[:-3], nn.ModuleList(modules[:-3]))
1253  self.assertEqual(module_list[::-1], nn.ModuleList(modules[::-1]))
1254  del module_list[-1]
1255  self.assertEqual(module_list, nn.ModuleList(modules[:-1]))
1256  del module_list[1::2]
1257  self.assertEqual(module_list, nn.ModuleList(modules[:-1][0::2]))
1258 
1259  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1260  module_list += nn.ReLU()
1261  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1262  module_list.extend(nn.ReLU())
1263 
1264  l1 = nn.Linear(1, 2)
1265  l2 = nn.Linear(2, 3)
1266  l3 = nn.Linear(3, 2)
1267  l4 = nn.Linear(2, 3)
1268  subnet = nn.Sequential(l3, l4)
1269  s = nn.Sequential(
1270  OrderedDict([
1271  ("layer1", l1),
1272  ("layer2", l2),
1273  ("layer3", l3),
1274  ("layer4", l4),
1275  ("subnet_layer", subnet)
1276  ])
1277  )
1278  modules = list(s.modules())
1279  module_list = nn.ModuleList()
1280  module_list.extend(s.modules())
1281  check()
1282 
1283  def test_ModuleDict(self):
1284  modules = OrderedDict([
1285  ('act', nn.ReLU()),
1286  ('conv', nn.Conv2d(10, 10, 5)),
1287  ('fc', nn.Linear(5, 5)),
1288  ])
1289 
1290  module_dict = nn.ModuleDict(modules)
1291 
1292  def check():
1293  self.assertEqual(len(module_dict), len(modules))
1294  for k1, m2 in zip(modules, module_dict.children()):
1295  self.assertIs(modules[k1], m2)
1296  for k1, k2 in zip(modules, module_dict):
1297  self.assertIs(modules[k1], module_dict[k2])
1298  for k in module_dict:
1299  self.assertIs(module_dict[k], modules[k])
1300  for k in module_dict.keys():
1301  self.assertIs(module_dict[k], modules[k])
1302  for k, v in module_dict.items():
1303  self.assertIs(modules[k], v)
1304  for k1, m2 in zip(modules, module_dict.values()):
1305  self.assertIs(modules[k1], m2)
1306  for k in modules.keys():
1307  self.assertTrue(k in module_dict)
1308  check()
1309 
1310  modules['conv'] = nn.Conv2d(3, 4, 3)
1311  module_dict['conv'] = modules['conv']
1312  check()
1313 
1314  next_modules = [
1315  ('fc2', nn.Linear(5, 5)),
1316  ('act', nn.Sigmoid()),
1317  ]
1318  modules.update(next_modules)
1319  module_dict.update(next_modules)
1320  check()
1321 
1322  next_modules = OrderedDict([
1323  ('fc3', nn.Linear(5, 5)),
1324  ('act2', nn.Sigmoid()),
1325  ])
1326  modules.update(next_modules)
1327  module_dict.update(next_modules)
1328  check()
1329 
1330  next_modules = {
1331  'fc4': nn.Linear(5, 5),
1332  'act3': nn.Sigmoid()
1333  }
1334  modules.update(sorted(next_modules.items()))
1335  module_dict.update(next_modules)
1336  check()
1337 
1338  del module_dict['fc']
1339  del modules['fc']
1340  check()
1341 
1342  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1343  module_dict.update(nn.ReLU())
1344 
1345  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1346  module_dict.update([nn.ReLU()])
1347 
1348  with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
1349  module_dict.update([[nn.ReLU()]])
1350 
1351  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1352  module_dict[1] = nn.ReLU()
1353 
1354  s = nn.Sequential(modules)
1355  module_dict = nn.ModuleDict(s.named_children())
1356  check()
1357 
1358  c = module_dict.pop('conv')
1359  self.assertIs(c, modules['conv'])
1360  modules.pop('conv')
1361  check()
1362 
1363  module_dict.clear()
1364  self.assertEqual(len(module_dict), 0)
1365  modules.clear()
1366  check()
1367 
1368  def test_ParameterList(self):
1369  def make_param():
1370  return Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))
1371  parameters = [make_param(), make_param()]
1372  param_list = nn.ParameterList(parameters)
1373 
1374  def check():
1375  self.assertEqual(len(parameters), len(param_list))
1376  for p1, p2 in zip(parameters, param_list):
1377  self.assertIs(p1, p2)
1378  for p1, p2 in zip(parameters, param_list.parameters()):
1379  self.assertIs(p1, p2)
1380  for i in range(len(parameters)):
1381  self.assertIs(parameters[i], param_list[i])
1382 
1383  check()
1384  parameters += [make_param()]
1385  param_list += [parameters[-1]]
1386  check()
1387  parameters.append(make_param())
1388  param_list.append(parameters[-1])
1389  check()
1390  next_params = [make_param(), make_param()]
1391  parameters.extend(next_params)
1392  param_list.extend(next_params)
1393  check()
1394  parameters[2] = make_param()
1395  param_list[2] = parameters[2]
1396  check()
1397  parameters[-1] = make_param()
1398  param_list[-1] = parameters[-1]
1399  check()
1400  idx = torch.tensor(2, dtype=torch.int32)
1401  parameters[2] = make_param()
1402  param_list[idx] = parameters[2]
1403  self.assertIs(param_list[idx], parameters[2])
1404  check()
1405  self.assertEqual(param_list[1:], nn.ParameterList(parameters[1:]))
1406  self.assertEqual(param_list[3:], nn.ParameterList(parameters[3:]))
1407  self.assertEqual(param_list[:-1], nn.ParameterList(parameters[:-1]))
1408  self.assertEqual(param_list[:-3], nn.ParameterList(parameters[:-3]))
1409  self.assertEqual(param_list[::-1], nn.ParameterList(parameters[::-1]))
1410 
1411  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1412  param_list += make_param()
1413  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1414  param_list.extend(make_param())
1415 
1416  l1 = nn.Linear(1, 2)
1417  l2 = nn.Linear(2, 3)
1418  l3 = nn.Linear(3, 2)
1419  l4 = nn.Linear(2, 3)
1420  subnet = nn.Sequential(l3, l4)
1421  s = nn.Sequential(
1422  OrderedDict([
1423  ("layer1", l1),
1424  ("layer2", l2),
1425  ("layer3", l3),
1426  ("layer4", l4),
1427  ("subnet_layer", subnet)
1428  ])
1429  )
1430  parameters = list(s.parameters())
1431  param_list = nn.ParameterList()
1432  param_list.extend(s.parameters())
1433  check()
1434 
1435  def test_ParameterDict(self):
1436  parameters = OrderedDict([
1437  ('p1', Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))),
1438  ('p2', Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))),
1439  ('p3', Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))),
1440  ])
1441 
1442  parameter_dict = nn.ParameterDict(parameters)
1443 
1444  def check():
1445  self.assertEqual(len(parameter_dict), len(parameters))
1446  for k1, m2 in zip(parameters, parameter_dict.parameters()):
1447  self.assertIs(parameters[k1], m2)
1448  for k1, k2 in zip(parameters, parameter_dict):
1449  self.assertIs(parameters[k1], parameter_dict[k2])
1450  for k in parameter_dict:
1451  self.assertIs(parameter_dict[k], parameters[k])
1452  for k in parameter_dict.keys():
1453  self.assertIs(parameter_dict[k], parameters[k])
1454  for k, v in parameter_dict.items():
1455  self.assertIs(v, parameters[k])
1456  for k1, m2 in zip(parameters, parameter_dict.values()):
1457  self.assertIs(parameters[k1], m2)
1458  for k in parameters.keys():
1459  self.assertTrue(k in parameter_dict)
1460 
1461  check()
1462 
1463  parameters['p4'] = Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))
1464  parameter_dict['p4'] = parameters['p4']
1465  check()
1466 
1467  next_parameters = [
1468  ('p5', Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))),
1469  ('p2', Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))),
1470  ]
1471  parameters.update(next_parameters)
1472  parameter_dict.update(next_parameters)
1473  check()
1474 
1475  next_parameters = OrderedDict([
1476  ('p6', Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))),
1477  ('p5', Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))),
1478  ])
1479  parameters.update(next_parameters)
1480  parameter_dict.update(next_parameters)
1481  check()
1482 
1483  next_parameters = {
1484  'p8': Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10)),
1485  'p7': Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))
1486  }
1487  parameters.update(sorted(next_parameters.items()))
1488  parameter_dict.update(next_parameters)
1489  check()
1490 
1491  del parameter_dict['p3']
1492  del parameters['p3']
1493  check()
1494 
1495  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1496  parameter_dict.update(1)
1497 
1498  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1499  parameter_dict.update([1])
1500 
1501  with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
1502  parameter_dict.update(Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10)))
1503 
1504  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1505  parameter_dict[1] = Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))
1506 
1507  p_pop = parameter_dict.pop('p4')
1508  self.assertIs(p_pop, parameters['p4'])
1509  parameters.pop('p4')
1510  check()
1511 
1512  parameter_dict.clear()
1513  self.assertEqual(len(parameter_dict), 0)
1514  parameters.clear()
1515  check()
1516 
1517  def test_add_module(self):
1518  l = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1519  net = nn.Module()
1520  net.l = l
1521  net.l2 = l
1522  net.add_module('empty', None)
1523  self.assertEqual(net.l, l)
1524  self.assertEqual(net.l2, l)
1525  self.assertEqual(net.empty, None)
1526  net.add_module('l3', l)
1527  self.assertEqual(net.l3, l)
1528  l3 = nn.Linear(20, 10)
1529  net.add_module('l', l3)
1530  self.assertEqual(net.l, l3)
1531  self.assertRaises(TypeError, lambda: net.add_module('x', 'non-module'))
1532  self.assertRaisesRegex(TypeError, 'module name should be a string. Got int',
1533  lambda: net.add_module(1, l))
1534  self.assertRaisesRegex(TypeError, 'module name should be a string. Got NoneType',
1535  lambda: net.add_module(None, l))
1536 
1537  def test_module_to_argparse(self):
1538  net = nn.Sequential(nn.Linear(3, 3))
1539  cpu = torch.device('cpu')
1540  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1541  net.to(cpu, True)
1542  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1543  net.to(torch.long)
1544  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1545  net.to(None, True)
1546  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1547  net.to(cpu, torch.long, True)
1548  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1549  net.to(cpu, dtype=torch.long, non_blocking=True)
1550  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1551  net.to([])
1552  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1553  net.to({}, non_blocking=True)
1554  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1555  net.to(torch.tensor(3, dtype=torch.long), non_blocking=True)
1556  with self.assertRaises(TypeError):
1557  net.to(cpu, torch.tensor(3, dtype=torch.long), non_blocking=True)
1558 
1559  def test_type(self):
1560  l = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1561  net = nn.Module()
1562  net.l = l
1563  net.l2 = l
1564  net.add_module('empty', None)
1565  net.register_buffer('indices', torch.LongTensor(1))
1566  net.float()
1567  self.assertIsInstance(l.weight.data, torch.FloatTensor)
1568  self.assertIsInstance(l.bias.data, torch.FloatTensor)
1569  self.assertIsInstance(net.indices, torch.LongTensor)
1570  net.double()
1571  self.assertIsInstance(l.weight.data, torch.DoubleTensor)
1572  self.assertIsInstance(l.bias.data, torch.DoubleTensor)
1573  self.assertIsInstance(net.indices, torch.LongTensor)
1574  net.to(torch.half)
1575  self.assertIsInstance(l.weight.data, torch.HalfTensor)
1576  self.assertIsInstance(l.bias.data, torch.HalfTensor)
1577  self.assertIsInstance(net.indices, torch.LongTensor)
1578  if TEST_CUDA:
1579  net.float().cuda()
1580  self.assertIsInstance(l.weight.data, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)
1581  self.assertIsInstance(l.bias.data, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)
1582  self.assertIsInstance(net.indices, torch.cuda.LongTensor)
1583  net.cpu()
1584  self.assertIsInstance(l.weight.data, torch.FloatTensor)
1585  self.assertIsInstance(l.bias.data, torch.FloatTensor)
1586  self.assertIsInstance(net.indices, torch.LongTensor)
1587  net.to("cuda", torch.double, True)
1588  self.assertIsInstance(l.weight.data, torch.cuda.DoubleTensor)
1589  self.assertIsInstance(l.bias.data, torch.cuda.DoubleTensor)
1590  self.assertIsInstance(net.indices, torch.cuda.LongTensor)
1591  net.to(torch.empty(1, device="cuda:0", dtype=torch.half))
1592  self.assertIsInstance(l.weight.data, torch.cuda.HalfTensor)
1593  self.assertIsInstance(l.bias.data, torch.cuda.HalfTensor)
1594  self.assertIsInstance(net.indices, torch.cuda.LongTensor)
1595  net.to(torch.device("cpu"), non_blocking=True)
1596  self.assertIsInstance(l.weight.data, torch.HalfTensor)
1597  self.assertIsInstance(l.bias.data, torch.HalfTensor)
1598  self.assertIsInstance(net.indices, torch.LongTensor)
1599  net.type(torch.FloatTensor)
1600  self.assertIsInstance(l.weight.data, torch.FloatTensor)
1601  self.assertIsInstance(l.bias.data, torch.FloatTensor)
1602  net.to(torch.DoubleTensor(1))
1603  self.assertIsInstance(l.weight.data, torch.DoubleTensor)
1604  self.assertIsInstance(l.bias.data, torch.DoubleTensor)
1605  if TEST_CUDA:
1606  net.type(torch.cuda.FloatTensor)
1607  self.assertIsInstance(l.weight.data, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)
1608  self.assertIsInstance(l.bias.data, torch.cuda.FloatTensor)
1609 
1610  def test_non_leaf_parameters(self):
1611  l1 = nn.Linear(10, 10)
1612  l2 = nn.Linear(10, 10)
1613 
1614  def assign_weight():
1615  l2.weight = l1.weight + 2
1616 
1617  self.assertRaises(TypeError, assign_weight)
1618  # This should work though
1619  l2.weight = Parameter(torch.randn(10, 10))
1620 
1621  def test_clip_grad_norm(self):
1622  l = nn.Linear(10, 10)
1623  max_norm = 2
1624 
1625  def compute_norm(norm_type):
1626  norm_type = float(norm_type)
1627  if norm_type != inf:
1628  total_norm = 0
1629  for p in l.parameters():
1630  total_norm += p.grad.data.abs().pow(norm_type).sum()
1631  return pow(total_norm, 1. / norm_type)
1632  else:
1633  return max(p.grad.data.abs().max() for p in l.parameters())
1634 
1635  def compare_scaling(grads):
1636  p_scale = [p.grad.data.div(g).view(-1) for p, g in zip(l.parameters(), grads)]
1637  scale = torch.cat(p_scale)
1638  self.assertEqual(scale.std(), 0)
1639  return scale[0]
1640 
1641  grads = torch.arange(1., 101).view(10, 10), torch.ones(10).div(1000)
1642  for norm_type in [0.5, 1.5, 2, 4, 'inf']:
1643  for p, g in zip(l.parameters(), grads):
1644  p._grad = Variable(g.clone().view_as(p.data))
1645  norm_before = compute_norm(norm_type)
1646  norm = clip_grad_norm_(l.parameters(), max_norm, norm_type=norm_type)
1647  norm_after = compute_norm(norm_type)
1648  self.assertEqual(norm, norm_before)
1649  self.assertEqual(norm_after, max_norm)
1650  self.assertLessEqual(norm_after, norm_before)
1651  compare_scaling(grads)
1652 
1653  # Small gradients should be left unchanged
1654  grads = torch.rand(10, 10).div(10000), torch.ones(10).div(500)
1655  for norm_type in [0.5, 1.5, 2, 4, 'inf']:
1656  for p, g in zip(l.parameters(), grads):
1657  p.grad.data.copy_(g)
1658  norm_before = compute_norm(norm_type)
1659  norm = clip_grad_norm_(l.parameters(), max_norm, norm_type=norm_type)
1660  norm_after = compute_norm(norm_type)
1661  self.assertEqual(norm, norm_before)
1662  self.assertEqual(norm_before, norm_after)
1663  self.assertLessEqual(norm_after, max_norm)
1664  scale = compare_scaling(grads)
1665  self.assertEqual(scale, 1)
1666 
1667  # Should accept a single Tensor as input
1668  p1, p2 = torch.randn(10, 10), torch.randn(10, 10)
1669  g = torch.arange(1., 101).view(10, 10)
1670  p1._grad = g.clone()
1671  p2._grad = g.clone()
1672  for norm_type in [0.5, 1.5, 2, 4, 'inf']:
1673  clip_grad_norm_(p1, max_norm, norm_type=norm_type)
1674  clip_grad_norm_([p2], max_norm, norm_type=norm_type)
1675  self.assertEqual(p1.grad, p2.grad)
1676 
1677  def test_clip_grad_value(self):
1678  l = nn.Linear(10, 10)
1679  clip_value = 2.5
1680 
1681  grad_w, grad_b = torch.arange(-50., 50).view(10, 10).div_(5), torch.ones(10).mul_(2)
1682  for grad_list in [[grad_w, grad_b], [grad_w, None]]:
1683  for p, g in zip(l.parameters(), grad_list):
1684  p._grad = g.clone().view_as(p.data) if g is not None else g
1685 
1686  clip_grad_value_(l.parameters(), clip_value)
1687  for p in filter(lambda p: p.grad is not None, l.parameters()):
1688  self.assertLessEqual(p.grad.data.max(), clip_value)
1689  self.assertGreaterEqual(p.grad.data.min(), -clip_value)
1690 
1691  # Should accept a single Tensor as input
1692  p1, p2 = torch.randn(10, 10), torch.randn(10, 10)
1693  g = torch.arange(-50., 50).view(10, 10).div_(5)
1694  p1._grad = g.clone()
1695  p2._grad = g.clone()
1696  clip_grad_value_(p1, clip_value)
1697  clip_grad_value_([p2], clip_value)
1698  self.assertEqual(p1.grad, p2.grad)
1699 
1700  def test_parameters_to_vector(self):
1701  conv1 = nn.Conv2d(3, 10, 5)
1702  fc1 = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1703  model = nn.Sequential(conv1, fc1)
1704 
1705  vec = parameters_to_vector(model.parameters())
1706  self.assertEqual(vec.size(0), 980)
1707 
1708  def test_vector_to_parameters(self):
1709  conv1 = nn.Conv2d(3, 10, 5)
1710  fc1 = nn.Linear(10, 20)
1711  model = nn.Sequential(conv1, fc1)
1712 
1713  vec = Variable(torch.arange(0., 980))
1714  vector_to_parameters(vec, model.parameters())
1715 
1716  sample = next(model.parameters())[0, 0, 0]
1717  self.assertTrue(torch.equal(sample.data, vec.data[:5]))
1718 
1719  # We don't want to make propagating NaN a hard requirement on ops, but for
1720  # these easy ones, we should make them do so.
1721  def _test_nonlinearity_propagate_nan(self, device):
1722  def test(nonlinearity, *args, **kwargs):
1723  x = torch.tensor([nan], device=device)
1724  fn = getattr(F, nonlinearity)
1725  try:
1726  self.assertTrue(math.isnan(fn(x, *args, **kwargs).item()))
1727  except Exception as e:
1728  if 'not implemented' not in str(e):
1729  raise
1730 
1731  test('relu')
1732  test('relu', inplace=True)
1733  test('relu6')
1734  test('elu')
1735  test('selu')
1736  test('celu')
1737  test('rrelu')
1738  test('rrelu', inplace=True)
1739  test('hardtanh')
1740  test('tanh')
1741  test('sigmoid')
1742  test('logsigmoid')
1743  test('hardshrink')
1744  test('tanhshrink')
1745  test('softsign')
1746  test('softmin', 0)
1747  test('softmax', 0)
1748  test('log_softmax', 0)
1749  test('leaky_relu', 0.2)
1750  test('threshold', 3, 2)
1751  test('threshold', 3, 2, inplace=True)
1752 
1753  def test_nonlinearity_propagate_nan(self):
1754  self._test_nonlinearity_propagate_nan('cpu')
1755 
1756  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
1757  def test_nonlinearity_propagate_nan_cuda(self):
1758  self._test_nonlinearity_propagate_nan('cuda')
1759 
1760  def test_weight_norm(self):
1761  input = torch.randn(3, 5)
1762  m = nn.Linear(5, 7)
1763  expected_output = m(input)
1764 
1765  # add weight normalization
1766  m = torch.nn.utils.weight_norm(m)
1767  self.assertEqual(m.weight_v.size(), m.weight.size())
1768  self.assertEqual(m.weight_g.size(), (7, 1))
1769  self.assertEqual(m(input), expected_output)
1770 
1771  # remove weight norm
1772  m = torch.nn.utils.remove_weight_norm(m)
1773  self.assertFalse(hasattr(m, 'weight_g'))
1774  self.assertFalse(hasattr(m, 'weight_v'))
1775  self.assertEqual(m(input), expected_output)
1776 
1777  # test with dim=1
1778  m = torch.nn.utils.weight_norm(m, dim=1)
1779  self.assertEqual(m.weight_v.size(), m.weight.size())
1780  self.assertEqual(m.weight_g.size(), (1, 5))
1781  self.assertEqual(m(input), expected_output)
1782 
1783  # test with dim=None
1784  m = nn.Linear(5, 7)
1785  expected_output = m(input)
1786  m = torch.nn.utils.weight_norm(m, dim=None)
1787  self.assertEqual(m(input), expected_output)
1788 
1789  with self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError, 'register two weight_norm hooks'):
1790  m = torch.nn.utils.weight_norm(m)
1791  m = torch.nn.utils.weight_norm(m)
1792 
1793  def test_weight_norm_pickle(self):
1794  m = torch.nn.utils.weight_norm(nn.Linear(5, 7))
1795  m = pickle.loads(pickle.dumps(m))
1796  self.assertIsInstance(m, nn.Linear)
1797 
1798  @skipIfRocm
1799  def test_spectral_norm(self):
1800  input = torch.randn(3, 5)
1801  m = nn.Linear(5, 7)
1802  m = torch.nn.utils.spectral_norm(m)
1803 
1804  self.assertEqual(m.weight_u.size(), torch.Size([m.weight.size(0)]))
1805  # weight_orig should be trainable
1806  self.assertTrue(hasattr(m, 'weight_orig'))
1807  self.assertTrue('weight_orig' in m._parameters)
1808  # weight_u should be just a reused buffer
1809  self.assertTrue(hasattr(m, 'weight_u'))
1810  self.assertTrue('weight_u' in m._buffers)
1811  self.assertTrue('weight_v' in m._buffers)
1812  # weight should be a plain attribute, not counted as a buffer or a param
1813  self.assertFalse('weight' in m._buffers)
1814  self.assertFalse('weight' in m._parameters)
1815  # it should also be sharing storage as `weight_orig`
1816  self.assertEqual(m.weight_orig.storage(), m.weight.storage())
1817  self.assertEqual(m.weight_orig.size(), m.weight.size())
1818  self.assertEqual(m.weight_orig.stride(), m.weight.stride())
1819 
1820  m = torch.nn.utils.remove_spectral_norm(m)
1821  self.assertFalse(hasattr(m, 'weight_orig'))
1822  self.assertFalse(hasattr(m, 'weight_u'))
1823  # weight should be converted back as a parameter
1824  self.assertTrue(hasattr(m, 'weight'))
1825  self.assertTrue('weight' in m._parameters)
1826 
1827  with self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError, 'register two spectral_norm hooks'):
1828  m = torch.nn.utils.spectral_norm(m)
1829  m = torch.nn.utils.spectral_norm(m)
1830 
1831  # test correctness in training/eval modes and cpu/multi-gpu settings
1832  for apply_dp in (True, False):
1833  if apply_dp:
1834  if not TEST_MULTIGPU:
1835  continue
1836  device = torch.device('cuda:0')
1837 
1838  def maybe_wrap(m):
1839  return torch.nn.DataParallel(m, [0, 1])
1840  else:
1841  device = torch.device('cpu')
1842 
1843  def maybe_wrap(m):
1844  return m
1845 
1846  for requires_grad in (True, False):
1847  m = nn.Linear(3, 4).to(device)
1848  m.weight.requires_grad_(requires_grad)
1849  m = torch.nn.utils.spectral_norm(m)
1850  wrapped_m = maybe_wrap(m)
1851  self.assertTrue(hasattr(m, 'weight_u'))
1852  u0 = m.weight_u.clone()
1853  v0 = m.weight_v.clone()
1854 
1855  # TEST TRAINING BEHAVIOR
1856 
1857  # assert that u and v are updated
1858  input = torch.randn(2, 3, device=device)
1859  out = wrapped_m(input)
1860  self.assertNotEqual(u0, m.weight_u)
1861  self.assertNotEqual(v0, m.weight_v)
1862 
1863  # assert that backprop reaches weight_orig
1864  # can't use gradcheck because the function changes as we
1865  # activate through it in training mode
1866  if requires_grad:
1867  torch.autograd.grad(out.sum(), m.weight_orig)
1868 
1869  # test backward works with multiple forwards
1870  # it uses training mode so we need to reset `u` and `v` vectors
1871  # to same value at beginning for finite difference test to pass
1872  saved_u = m.weight_u.clone()
1873  saved_v = m.weight_v.clone()
1874 
1875  def fn(input):
1876  m.weight_u.data.copy_(saved_u)
1877  m.weight_v.data.copy_(saved_v)
1878  out0 = wrapped_m(input)
1879  out1 = wrapped_m(input)
1880  return out0 + out1
1881 
1882  torch.autograd.gradcheck(fn, (input.clone().requires_grad_(),))
1883 
1884  # test removing
1885  pre_remove_out = wrapped_m(input)
1886  m = torch.nn.utils.remove_spectral_norm(m)
1887  self.assertEqual(wrapped_m(input), pre_remove_out)
1888 
1889  m = torch.nn.utils.spectral_norm(m)
1890  for _ in range(3):
1891  pre_remove_out = wrapped_m(input)
1892  m = torch.nn.utils.remove_spectral_norm(m)
1893  self.assertEqual(wrapped_m(input), pre_remove_out)
1894 
1895  # TEST EVAL BEHAVIOR
1896 
1897  m = torch.nn.utils.spectral_norm(m)
1898  wrapped_m(input)
1899  last_train_out = wrapped_m(input)
1900  last_train_u = m.weight_u.clone()
1901  last_train_v = m.weight_v.clone()
1902  wrapped_m.zero_grad()
1903  wrapped_m.eval()
1904 
1905  eval_out0 = wrapped_m(input)
1906  # assert eval gives same result as last training iteration
1907  self.assertEqual(eval_out0, last_train_out)
1908  # assert doing more iteartion in eval don't change things
1909  self.assertEqual(eval_out0, wrapped_m(input))
1910  self.assertEqual(last_train_u, m.weight_u)
1911  self.assertEqual(last_train_v, m.weight_v)
1912 
1913  # FIXME: the code below is flaky when executed with DataParallel
1914  # see https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/13818
1915  if apply_dp:
1916  continue
1917 
1918  # test backward works with multiple forwards in mixed training
1919  # and eval modes
1920  # it uses training mode so we need to reset `u` and `v` vectors
1921  # to same value at beginning for finite difference test to pass
1922  saved_u = m.weight_u.clone()
1923  saved_v = m.weight_v.clone()
1924 
1925  def fn(input):
1926  m.weight_u.data.copy_(saved_u)
1927  m.weight_v.data.copy_(saved_v)
1928  wrapped_m.train()
1929  out0 = wrapped_m(input)
1930  wrapped_m.eval()
1931  out1 = wrapped_m(input)
1932  wrapped_m.train()
1933  out2 = wrapped_m(input)
1934  wrapped_m.eval()
1935  out3 = wrapped_m(input)
1936  return out0 + out1 + out2 + out3
1937 
1938  torch.autograd.gradcheck(fn, (input.clone().requires_grad_(),))
1939 
1940  # assert that backprop reaches weight_orig in eval
1941  if requires_grad:
1942  def fn(weight):
1943  return wrapped_m(input)
1944 
1945  torch.autograd.gradcheck(fn, (m.weight_orig,))
1946 
1947  def test_spectral_norm_load_state_dict(self):
1948  inp = torch.randn(2, 3)
1949  for activate_times in (0, 3):
1950  # Test backward compatibility
1951  # At version None -> 1: weight becomes not a buffer and v vector becomes a buffer
1952  m = nn.Linear(3, 5)
1953  snm = torch.nn.utils.spectral_norm(m)
1954  snm.train()
1955  for _ in range(activate_times):
1956  snm(inp)
1957 
1958  # craft a version None state_dict
1959  version_none_state_dict = deepcopy(snm.state_dict())
1960  self.assertEqual({'weight_orig', 'bias', 'weight_u', 'weight_v'}, set(version_none_state_dict.keys()))
1961  self.assertIn('spectral_norm', version_none_state_dict._metadata[''])
1962  del version_none_state_dict._metadata['']['spectral_norm'] # remove metadata info
1963  del version_none_state_dict['weight_v'] # remove v vector
1964  version_none_state_dict['weight'] = snm.weight.detach().clone() # set W as a buffer
1965 
1966  # normal state_dict
1967  version_latest_state_dict = deepcopy(snm.state_dict())
1968 
1969  snm.eval()
1970  out0_eval = snm(inp)
1971  snm.train()
1972  out1_train = snm(inp)
1973  out2_train = snm(inp)
1974  snm.eval()
1975  out3_eval = snm(inp)
1976 
1977  snm.load_state_dict(version_none_state_dict)
1978  if activate_times > 0:
1979  # since in loading version None state dict, we assume that the
1980  # values in the state dict have gone through at lease one
1981  # forward, we only test for equivalence when activate_times > 0.
1982  snm.eval()
1983  self.assertEqual(out0_eval, snm(inp))
1984  snm.train()
1985  self.assertEqual(out1_train, snm(inp))
1986  self.assertEqual(out2_train, snm(inp))
1987  snm.eval()
1988  self.assertEqual(out3_eval, snm(inp))
1989 
1990  # Test normal loading
1991  snm.load_state_dict(version_latest_state_dict)
1992  snm.eval()
1993  self.assertEqual(out0_eval, snm(inp))
1994  snm.train()
1995  self.assertEqual(out1_train, snm(inp))
1996  self.assertEqual(out2_train, snm(inp))
1997  snm.eval()
1998  self.assertEqual(out3_eval, snm(inp))
1999 
2000  def test_spectral_norm_dim(self):
2001  inp = torch.randn(2, 3, 10, 12)
2002  m = nn.ConvTranspose2d(3, 4, (5, 6))
2003  m = torch.nn.utils.spectral_norm(m)
2004  # this should not run into incompatible shapes
2005  x = m(inp)
2006  # check that u refers to the same dimension
2007  self.assertEqual(m.weight_u.shape, m.weight_orig[0, :, 0, 0].shape)
2008 
2009  def test_spectral_norm_forward(self):
2010  input = torch.randn(3, 5)
2011  m = nn.Linear(5, 7)
2012  m = torch.nn.utils.spectral_norm(m)
2013  # naive forward
2014  _weight, _bias, _u = m.weight_orig, m.bias, m.weight_u
2015  _weight_mat = _weight.view(_weight.size(0), -1)
2016  _v = torch.mv(_weight_mat.t(), _u)
2017  _v = F.normalize(_v, dim=0, eps=1e-12)
2018  _u = torch.mv(_weight_mat, _v)
2019  _u = F.normalize(_u, dim=0, eps=1e-12)
2020  _weight.data /= torch.dot(_u, torch.matmul(_weight_mat, _v))
2021  out_hat = torch.nn.functional.linear(input, _weight, _bias)
2022  expect_out = m(input)
2023  self.assertAlmostEqual(expect_out, out_hat)
2024 
2025  def test_spectral_norm_pickle(self):
2026  m = torch.nn.utils.spectral_norm(nn.Linear(5, 7))
2027  m = pickle.loads(pickle.dumps(m))
2028  self.assertIsInstance(m, nn.Linear)
2029 
2030  def test_threshold_int(self):
2031  x = torch.tensor([-3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3])
2032  expected = torch.tensor([99, 99, 99, 99, 1, 2, 3])
2033  self.assertEqual(F.threshold(x, 0, 99), expected)
2034 
2035  def test_embedding_sparse_basic(self):
2036  embedding = nn.Embedding(10, 20, sparse=True)
2037  input = Variable(torch.LongTensor([[0, 2, 4, 5], [4, 3, 0, 9]]))
2038  embedding(input).sum().backward()
2039  self.assertTrue(embedding.weight.grad.is_sparse)
2040  self.assertEqual(embedding.weight.grad.shape, embedding.weight.shape)
2041 
2042  def test_embedding_sparse_empty_tensor(self):
2043  embedding = nn.Embedding(0, 0, sparse=True)
2044  input = torch.tensor([], dtype=torch.int64)
2045  embedding(input).sum().backward()
2046  self.assertTrue(embedding.weight.grad.is_sparse)
2047  self.assertEqual(embedding.weight.grad.shape, embedding.weight.shape)
2048 
2049  embedding = nn.Embedding(10, 0, sparse=True)
2050  input = torch.LongTensor([[0, 2, 4, 5], [4, 3, 0, 9]])
2051  embedding(input).sum().backward()
2052  self.assertTrue(embedding.weight.grad.is_sparse)
2053  self.assertEqual(embedding.weight.grad.shape, embedding.weight.shape)
2054 
2055  def test_embedding_sparse_backward(self):
2056  embedding = nn.Embedding(10, 3, sparse=True)
2057  embedding.zero_grad()
2058  embedding(torch.LongTensor([7, 1, 3])).sum().backward()
2059  self.assertEqual(embedding.weight.grad._indices(), torch.LongTensor([[7, 1, 3]]))
2060  self.assertEqual(embedding.weight.grad._values(), torch.tensor(1.).expand(3, 3))
2061 
2062  embedding.zero_grad()
2063  embedding(torch.LongTensor([7, 1, 3])).sum().backward()
2064  embedding(torch.LongTensor([7, 1, 3])).sum().backward()
2065  self.assertEqual(embedding.weight.grad._indices(), torch.LongTensor([[7, 1, 3, 7, 1, 3]]))
2066  self.assertEqual(embedding.weight.grad._values(), torch.tensor(1.).expand(6, 3))
2067 
2068  embedding.zero_grad()
2069  embedding(torch.LongTensor([7, 1, 3])).sum().backward()
2070  embedding(torch.LongTensor([8, 1, 3])).sum().backward()
2071  self.assertEqual(embedding.weight.grad._indices(), torch.LongTensor([[7, 1, 3, 8, 1, 3]]))
2072  self.assertEqual(embedding.weight.grad._values(), torch.tensor(1.).expand(6, 3))
2073 
2074  def test_embedding_padding_idx(self):
2075  embedding = nn.Embedding(10, 20, padding_idx=0)
2076  input = Variable(torch.LongTensor([[0, 2, 4, 5], [4, 3, 0, 9]]))
2077  output = embedding(input)
2078  self.assertEqual(output[0][0].sum(), 0)
2079  self.assertEqual(output[1][2].sum(), 0)
2080 
2081  embedding = nn.Embedding(10, 20, padding_idx=0, sparse=True)
2082  input = Variable(torch.LongTensor([[0, 2, 4, 5], [4, 3, 0, 9]]))
2083  output = embedding(input)
2084  self.assertEqual(output[0][0].sum(), 0)
2085  self.assertEqual(output[1][2].sum(), 0)
2086 
2087  # negative indexing check for padding_idx
2088  # padding_idx=-2, num_embeddings=10 ==> index 8 padded
2089  embedding = nn.Embedding(10, 20, padding_idx=-2)
2090  input = Variable(torch.LongTensor([[0, 2, 8, 5], [4, 8, 0, 9]]))
2091  output = embedding(input)
2092  self.assertEqual(output[0][2].sum(), 0)
2093  self.assertEqual(output[1][1].sum(), 0)
2094 
2095  embedding = nn.Embedding(10, 20, padding_idx=-2, sparse=True)
2096  input = Variable(torch.LongTensor([[0, 2, 8, 5], [4, 8, 0, 9]]))
2097  output = embedding(input)
2098  self.assertEqual(output[0][2].sum(), 0)
2099  self.assertEqual(output[1][1].sum(), 0)
2100 
2101  # out of bounds check for padding_idx
2102  self.assertRaises(AssertionError, nn.Embedding, num_embeddings=10, embedding_dim=20, padding_idx=25)
2103  self.assertRaises(AssertionError, nn.Embedding, num_embeddings=10, embedding_dim=20, padding_idx=-25)
2104 
2105  # test backward when input contains padding_idx
2106  padding_idx = 0
2107  embedding = nn.Embedding(5, 2, padding_idx=padding_idx)
2108  for n in (1, 2):
2109  for other_indices in ([], [1, 3], [2]):
2110  indices = torch.LongTensor(other_indices + [padding_idx] * n)
2111  pre = embedding.weight[padding_idx].clone()
2112  embedding(indices).sum().backward()
2113  after = (embedding.weight + embedding.weight.grad)[padding_idx]
2114  embedding.zero_grad()
2115  self.assertEqual(after, pre)
2116 
2117  def test_embedding_max_norm(self):
2118  embedding = nn.Embedding(22, 5, max_norm=1.0)
2119  input = Variable(torch.LongTensor([2, 8, 8, 6]))
2120  output = embedding(input)
2121  self.assertEqual(output[1], output[2])
2122  self.assertTrue(output.data.norm(p=2, dim=1).le(1).all())
2123 
2124  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2125  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
2126  def test_embedding_max_norm_cuda(self, dtype=torch.float):
2127  embedding = nn.Embedding(22, 5, max_norm=1.0).to("cuda", dtype=dtype)
2128  # nn.Embedding only takes LongTensor as input
2129  input = torch.tensor([2, 8, 8, 6], device="cuda", dtype=torch.long)
2130  output = embedding(input)
2131  self.assertEqual(output[1], output[2])
2132  self.assertTrue(output.data.norm(p=2, dim=1).le(1).all())
2133 
2134  def test_embedding_from_pretrained(self):
2135  a = torch.Tensor([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
2136  embedding = nn.Embedding.from_pretrained(a)
2137  self.assertEqual(a, embedding.weight.data)
2138 
2139  input = torch.LongTensor([0, 1])
2140  output = embedding(input)
2141  self.assertEqual(a, output)
2142 
2143  def test_embedding_from_pretrained_options(self):
2144  a = torch.Tensor([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
2145  opts = {
2146  "max_norm": 2.,
2147  "norm_type": .5,
2148  "scale_grad_by_freq": False,
2149  "sparse": True
2150  }
2151  embedding = nn.Embedding.from_pretrained(a, **opts)
2152  input = torch.LongTensor([0, 1])
2153  output = embedding(input)
2154  # test output and that weight matrix was renormalized
2155  self.assertEqual(a, output)
2156  self.assertTrue(a.ne(torch.arange(1, 7, dtype=a.dtype).view(2, 3)).all())
2157  self.assertTrue(output.data.norm(p=opts["norm_type"], dim=1).le(opts["max_norm"]).all())
2158 
2159  def test_embedding_functional(self):
2160  a = torch.tensor([
2161  [1, 3, 2],
2162  [0, 2, 1]
2163  ], dtype=torch.long)
2164  embeddings = torch.rand(4, 3, requires_grad=True)
2165 
2166  embed_old = torch.nn.Embedding(4, 3)
2167  embed_old.weight.data = embeddings.data
2168  res_old = embed_old(a)
2169 
2170  res_F = F.embedding(a, embeddings)
2171  self.assertEqual(res_old, res_F)
2172 
2173  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2174  @repeat_test_for_types([torch.float, torch.half])
2175  @skipIfRocm
2176  def test_softmax_dtype(self, dtype=torch.float):
2177  input = torch.rand(32, 100, device="cuda", dtype=dtype, requires_grad=True)
2178  inputf = input.to(torch.float).detach().requires_grad_(True)
2179  out = F.softmax(input, dim=-1, dtype=torch.float)
2180  outf = F.softmax(inputf, dim=-1)
2181  # should be bitwise equal
2182  self.assertEqual(out, outf, prec=0)
2183  gO = torch.empty_like(outf).uniform_()
2184  out.backward(gO)
2185  outf.backward(gO)
2186  # should be bitwise equal
2187  self.assertEqual(input.grad, inputf.grad.to(dtype), prec=0)
2188 
2189  def _test_softmax_backward(self, device):
2190  if device.type == 'cuda':
2191  dtypes = [torch.float, torch.half]
2192  else:
2193  dtypes = [torch.float]
2194  # FIXME: add (10, 0) after https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/17262 is fixed
2195  sizes = [(0, 10), (32, 20)]
2196  for fn in [F.softmax, F.log_softmax]:
2197  for dtype in dtypes:
2198  for size in sizes:
2199  input = torch.rand(size, device=device, dtype=dtype, requires_grad=True)
2200  output = fn(input, dtype=torch.float, dim=1).sum()
2201  grad_input, = torch.autograd.grad(output, input, create_graph=True)
2202  grad_input.sum().backward()
2203 
2204  def test_softmax_backward(self):
2205  self._test_softmax_backward(torch.device('cpu'))
2206 
2207  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2208  @skipIfRocm
2209  def test_softmax_backward_cuda(self):
2210  self._test_softmax_backward(torch.device('cuda'))
2211 
2212  def _test_gumbel_softmax_st_shapes(self, cuda, dtype, shape, dim, count_expected):
2213  logits = torch.randn(shape, dtype=torch.float)
2214  logits = logits.to(dtype)
2215  if cuda:
2216  logits = logits.cuda()
2217 
2218  y_draw = F.gumbel_softmax(logits, hard=True, dim=dim)
2219 
2220  # All values positive
2221  self.assertGreaterEqual(y_draw.min(), 0)
2222  # Shape unchanged
2223  self.assertTrue(y_draw.shape == logits.shape)
2224  # One choice per draw
2225  self.assertEqual(y_draw.sum(), count_expected, prec=torch.finfo(y_draw.dtype).eps)
2226 
2227  def _test_gumbel_softmax_straight_through(self, cuda, dtype):
2228  num_draws = 100
2229 
2230  logits = torch.tensor([[0.2, 0.8, 0.1]])
2231  logits = logits.reshape([1, 3])
2232  logits = logits.to(dtype).requires_grad_()
2233  if cuda:
2234  logits = logits.cuda()
2235  probs = logits.softmax(dim=-1)
2236 
2237  counts = torch.zeros_like(logits)
2238  for _ in range(num_draws):
2239  y_draw = F.gumbel_softmax(logits, hard=True)
2240  counts = counts + y_draw
2241 
2242  # All values positive
2243  self.assertGreaterEqual(y_draw.min(), 0)
2244  # Each experiment should result in 1 draw.
2245  self.assertEqual(counts.sum(), num_draws, prec=torch.finfo(counts.dtype).eps)
2246 
2247  # check results is asymptotically as expected.
2248  expected = probs * num_draws
2249  # ~z is approximately N(0,1) for unbiased count
2250  z = (counts - expected) / (expected * (1 - probs)).sqrt()
2251  # A (lazy) approximate 99% two-sided test:
2252  # occurs with prob alpha~>=0.01 if unbiased
2253  self.assertLess(z.abs().max().item(), 2.58)
2254 
2255  def _test_gumbel_softmax_grad(self, cuda, dtype):
2256  # "hard" and "not hard" should propagate same gradient.
2257  device = torch.device("cuda") if cuda else torch.device("cpu")
2258  logits_soft = torch.zeros(10, 10, dtype=dtype, device=device, requires_grad=True)
2259  logits_hard = torch.zeros(10, 10, dtype=dtype, device=device, requires_grad=True)
2260 
2261  seed = torch.random.get_rng_state()
2262  y_soft = F.gumbel_softmax(logits_soft, hard=False)
2263  torch.random.set_rng_state(seed)
2264  y_hard = F.gumbel_softmax(logits_hard, hard=True)
2265 
2266  y_soft.sum().backward()
2267  y_hard.sum().backward()
2268 
2269  # 2eps = 1x addition + 1x subtraction.
2270  tol = 2 * torch.finfo(dtype).eps
2271  self.assertAlmostEqual(logits_soft.grad, logits_hard.grad, delta=tol)
2272 
2273  @repeat_test_for_types(NO_HALF_TENSORTYPES)
