2274  def test_gumbel_softmax(self, dtype=torch.float):
2275  """
2276  NO_HALF_TENSORTYPES because many half-ops doesnt work on cpu.
2277  """
2278  self._test_gumbel_softmax_st_shapes(cuda=False, dtype=dtype, shape=[5], dim=0, count_expected=1)
2279  self._test_gumbel_softmax_st_shapes(cuda=False, dtype=dtype, shape=[5], dim=-1, count_expected=1)
2280  self._test_gumbel_softmax_st_shapes(cuda=False, dtype=dtype, shape=[5, 4], dim=1, count_expected=5)
2281  self._test_gumbel_softmax_st_shapes(cuda=False, dtype=dtype, shape=[5, 4, 3], dim=1, count_expected=5 * 3)
2282  self._test_gumbel_softmax_st_shapes(cuda=False, dtype=dtype, shape=[5, 4, 3], dim=-1, count_expected=5 * 4)
2283  self._test_gumbel_softmax_straight_through(cuda=False, dtype=dtype)
2284  self._test_gumbel_softmax_grad(cuda=False, dtype=dtype)
2285 
2286  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2287  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
2288  def test_gumbel_softmax_cuda(self, dtype=torch.float):
2289  self._test_gumbel_softmax_st_shapes(cuda=True, dtype=dtype, shape=[5], dim=0, count_expected=1)
2290  self._test_gumbel_softmax_st_shapes(cuda=True, dtype=dtype, shape=[5], dim=-1, count_expected=1)
2291  self._test_gumbel_softmax_st_shapes(cuda=True, dtype=dtype, shape=[5, 4], dim=1, count_expected=5)
2292  self._test_gumbel_softmax_st_shapes(cuda=True, dtype=dtype, shape=[5, 4, 3], dim=1, count_expected=5 * 3)
2293  self._test_gumbel_softmax_st_shapes(cuda=True, dtype=dtype, shape=[5, 4, 3], dim=-1, count_expected=5 * 4)
2294  self._test_gumbel_softmax_straight_through(cuda=True, dtype=dtype)
2295  self._test_gumbel_softmax_grad(cuda=True, dtype=dtype)
2296 
2297  def _test_EmbeddingBag(self, cuda, mode, sparse, dtype=torch.double):
2298  # check a known test example
2299  device = torch.device("cuda") if cuda else torch.device("cpu")
2300  es = nn.EmbeddingBag(5, 2, mode=mode, sparse=sparse).to(device, dtype)
2301  es.weight.data.copy_(torch.arange(1, 11, device=device, dtype=dtype).view_as(es.weight))
2302  input = torch.tensor([3, 1, 1, 1, 4, 0], device=device, dtype=torch.long)
2303  offsets = torch.tensor([0, 0, 3, 3, 6], device=device, dtype=torch.long)
2304 
2305  grad_output = torch.tensor(
2306  [1, 2,
2307  3, 4], device=device, dtype=dtype).view(2, 2)
2308  grad_output_with_empty = torch.tensor(
2309  [99, 99,
2310  1, 2,
2311  99, 99,
2312  3, 4,
2313  99, 99], device=device, dtype=dtype).view(5, 2)
2314 
2315  if mode == "sum" or mode == "mean":
2316  denominator = 1 if mode == "sum" else 3
2317  expected_output = torch.tensor(
2318  [[13, 16],
2319  [13, 16]], device=device, dtype=dtype) / denominator
2320 
2321  expected_output_with_empty = torch.tensor(
2322  [[0, 0],
2323  [13, 16],
2324  [0, 0],
2325  [13, 16],
2326  [0, 0]], device=device, dtype=dtype) / denominator
2327 
2328  expected_grad_weight = torch.tensor(
2329  [[3, 4],
2330  [5, 8],
2331  [0, 0],
2332  [1, 2],
2333  [3, 4]], device=device, dtype=dtype) / denominator
2334  elif mode == "max":
2335  expected_output = torch.tensor(
2336  [[7, 8],
2337  [9, 10]], device=device, dtype=dtype)
2338 
2339  expected_output_with_empty = torch.tensor(
2340  [[0, 0],
2341  [7, 8],
2342  [0, 0],
2343  [9, 10],
2344  [0, 0]], device=device, dtype=dtype)
2345 
2346  expected_grad_weight = torch.tensor(
2347  [[0, 0],
2348  [0, 0],
2349  [0, 0],
2350  [1, 2],
2351  [3, 4]], device=device, dtype=dtype)
2352 
2353  output = es(input, offsets)
2354  output.backward(grad_output_with_empty)
2355 
2356  es_weight_grad = es.weight.grad.data
2357  if sparse:
2358  es_weight_grad = es.weight.grad.to_dense()
2359  self.assertEqual(output, expected_output_with_empty)
2360  self.assertEqual(es_weight_grad, expected_grad_weight, dtype2prec[dtype])
2361 
2362  # check same example except as 2D (2 x 3)
2363  input = input.view(2, -1)
2364  es.zero_grad()
2365  output = es(input)
2366  output.backward(grad_output)
2367 
2368  es_weight_grad = es.weight.grad
2369  if sparse:
2370  es_weight_grad = es.weight.grad.to_dense()
2371  self.assertEqual(output, expected_output)
2372  self.assertEqual(es_weight_grad, expected_grad_weight, dtype2prec[dtype])
2373 
2374  # test all empty bags
2375  es.zero_grad()
2376  inputs = torch.tensor([], dtype=torch.long, device=device)
2377  offsets = torch.tensor([0, 0, 0, 0], device=device)
2378  es(inputs, offsets).sum().backward()
2379  dense_grad = es.weight.grad
2380  if dense_grad.is_sparse:
2381  dense_grad = dense_grad.to_dense()
2382  self.assertEqual(dense_grad, torch.zeros_like(es.weight))
2383 
2384  # now compare EmbeddingBag vs Embedding + Sum/Mean, for constant bag length
2385  def _test_vs_Embedding(N, D, B, L, max_norm=None):
2386  es = nn.EmbeddingBag(N, D, mode=mode, sparse=sparse, max_norm=max_norm).to(device, dtype)
2387  e = nn.Embedding(N, D, max_norm=max_norm).to(device, dtype)
2388  e.weight.data.copy_(es.weight)
2389  input = torch.randint(N, (B, L), device=device, dtype=torch.long)
2390  offsets = torch.arange(0, B, device=device, dtype=torch.long).mul_(L)
2391  grad_output = torch.rand(B, D, device=device, dtype=dtype)
2392 
2393  output = es(input.view(-1), offsets)
2394  if mode == 'sum':
2395  ref_output = e(input).sum(1)
2396  elif mode == 'mean':
2397  ref_output = e(input).mean(1)
2398  elif mode == 'max':
2399  ref_output = e(input).max(1)[0]
2400 
2401  self.assertEqual(output, ref_output, dtype2prec[dtype])
2402 
2403  output.backward(grad_output)
2404  ref_output.backward(grad_output)
2405  es_weight_grad = es.weight.grad.data
2406  if sparse:
2407  es_weight_grad = es.weight.grad.data.to_dense()
2408 
2409  # We have more floating point error here because we are dealing with larger numbers
2410  needed_prec = dtype2prec[dtype] * 2
2411  self.assertEqual(es_weight_grad, e.weight.grad, needed_prec)
2412 
2413  N, D, B, L = random.randint(1, 100), random.randint(1, 100), random.randint(1, 50), random.randint(1, 50)
2414  _test_vs_Embedding(N, D, B, L)
2415  for max_norm in (None, 3):
2416  for p in itertools.product([1, 2], repeat=4):
2417  _test_vs_Embedding(*p, max_norm=max_norm)
2418 
2419  # check that giving illegal input combos raises error
2420  es = nn.EmbeddingBag(10, 20, mode=mode, sparse=sparse)
2421  input = torch.ones(3, 4)
2422  offset = torch.arange(0, 3)
2423  self.assertRaises(ValueError, lambda: es(input, offset))
2424  self.assertRaises(ValueError, lambda: es(input.view(-1)))
2425  offset[0] = 1
2426  self.assertRaises(ValueError, lambda: es(input.view(-1), offset))
2427  offset[0] = 0
2428  offset[-1] = 100
2429  self.assertRaises(ValueError, lambda: es(input.view(-1), offset))
2430 
2431  def test_embeddingbag_from_pretrained(self):
2432  a = torch.Tensor([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
2433  embeddingbag = nn.EmbeddingBag.from_pretrained(a)
2434  self.assertEqual(a, embeddingbag.weight.data)
2435 
2436  input = torch.LongTensor([[0, 1]])
2437  output = embeddingbag(input)
2438  self.assertEqual(a.mean(0, keepdim=True), output)
2439 
2440  def test_embeddingbag_from_pretrained_options(self):
2441  a = torch.Tensor([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
2442  opts = {
2443  "max_norm": 2.,
2444  "norm_type": .5,
2445  "scale_grad_by_freq": False,
2446  "mode": "max",
2447  "sparse": False
2448  }
2449  embeddingbag = nn.EmbeddingBag.from_pretrained(a, **opts)
2450 
2451  input = torch.LongTensor([[0, 1]])
2452  output = embeddingbag(input)
2453  self.assertEqual(a.max(0, keepdim=True)[0], output)
2454  self.assertTrue(a.ne(torch.arange(1, 7, dtype=a.dtype).view(2, 3)).all())
2455  self.assertTrue(a.norm(p=opts["norm_type"], dim=1).le(opts["max_norm"]).all())
2456 
2457  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2458  def test_pool3d_size_one_feature_dim(self):
2459  # Tests crazy strides for feature dim of size 1
2460  x = Variable(torch.randn(7, 1, 5, 3, 2, device="cuda"))
2461  strange_strides = [30, 1234, 6, 2, 1]
2462  y = x.as_strided(x.size(), strange_strides)
2463  x = x.cpu().as_strided(x.size(), strange_strides)
2464 
2465  to_test = {
2466  'max_pool3d': lambda t: F.max_pool3d(t, (5, 1, 1), stride=(5, 1, 1)),
2467  'avg_pool3d': lambda t: F.avg_pool3d(t, (5, 1, 1), stride=(5, 1, 1)),
2468  }
2469 
2470  for test, fn in to_test.items():
2471  # Should not crash
2472  out_y = fn(y)
2473  out_x = fn(x)
2474  self.assertEqual(out_y, out_x.cuda(), test)
2475 
2476  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2477  def test_AvgPool3d_backward_after_cat_dim1_cuda(self):
2478  # x has to have batch_size 1 to test contiguous checks
2479  x = torch.randn(1, 3, 4, 4, 4, device="cuda", requires_grad=True)
2480  y = F.avg_pool3d(x, kernel_size=3, padding=1, stride=2)
2481 
2482  grad = torch.randn(y.size(), device="cuda")
2483  # increase the stride in dimension 0. the tensor is still contiguous because size[0] is 1
2484  stride = list(grad.stride())
2485  stride[0] = stride[0] * 2
2486  grad.set_(grad.storage(), 0, grad.size(), stride)
2487  assert grad.is_contiguous()
2488 
2489  y.backward(grad)
2490 
2491  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDNN, "needs cudnn")
2492  def test_contig_wrong_stride_cudnn(self):
2493  # x has to have batch_size 1 to test contiguous checks
2494  x = torch.randn(1, 16, 5, 5, device="cuda")
2495  stride = list(x.stride())
2496  stride[0] = 20
2497  # change the stride in dimension 0. the tensor is still contiguous because size[0] is 1
2498  x.set_(x.storage(), 0, x.size(), stride)
2499  self.assertTrue(x.is_contiguous())
2500  F.conv_transpose2d(x, torch.randn(16, 1, 1, 1, device="cuda"))
2501  F.conv2d(x, torch.randn(1, 16, 1, 1, device="cuda"))
2502 
2503  def test_embedding_bag(self):
2504  self._test_EmbeddingBag(False, 'sum', False)
2505  self._test_EmbeddingBag(False, 'mean', False)
2506  self._test_EmbeddingBag(False, 'max', False)
2507 
2508  self._test_EmbeddingBag(False, 'sum', True)
2509  self._test_EmbeddingBag(False, 'mean', True)
2510 
2511  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2512  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
2513  def test_embedding_bag_cuda(self, dtype=torch.float):
2514  self._test_EmbeddingBag(True, 'sum', False, dtype)
2515  self._test_EmbeddingBag(True, 'mean', False, dtype)
2516  self._test_EmbeddingBag(True, 'max', False, dtype)
2517  if dtype != torch.half:
2518  # torch.cuda.sparse.HalfTensor is not enabled.
2519  self._test_EmbeddingBag(True, 'sum', True, dtype)
2520  self._test_EmbeddingBag(True, 'mean', True, dtype)
2521 
2522  def test_fractional_max_pool2d(self):
2523  x = torch.randn(1, 2, 7, 7, requires_grad=True)
2524  samples = x.new(1, 2, 2).uniform_()
2525 
2526  def func(x):
2527  return F.fractional_max_pool2d(
2528  x, (2, 2), output_size=(3, 3), _random_samples=samples)
2529 
2530  self.assertEqual(func(x).shape, (1, 2, 3, 3))
2531  gradcheck(func, [x])
2532  gradgradcheck(func, [x])
2533 
2534  x = torch.randn(2, 7, 7, requires_grad=True)
2535  samples = x.new(2, 2).uniform_()
2536  self.assertEqual(func(x).shape, (2, 3, 3))
2537  gradcheck(func, [x])
2538  gradgradcheck(func, [x])
2539

2590  def test_FeatureAlphaDropout(self):
2591  b = random.randint(1, 5)
2592  w = random.randint(1, 5)
2593  h = random.randint(1, 5)
2594  d = random.randint(1, 2)
2595  num_features = 1000

2597  self._test_alpha_dropout(nn.FeatureAlphaDropout, input)
2598 
2599  def _test_InstanceNorm_general(self, cls, input, device="cpu", dtype=torch.float):
2600  # default case track_running_stats=False
2601  b, c = input.size(0), input.size(1)
2602  input_var = input.to(device=device, dtype=dtype).requires_grad_()
2603 
2604  IN = cls(c, eps=0).to(device, dtype)
2605 
2606  output = IN(input_var)
2607  out_reshaped = output.view(b * c, -1)
2608 
2609  mean = out_reshaped.mean(1)
2610  var = out_reshaped.var(1, unbiased=False)
2611 
2612  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(mean.data).mean(), 0, delta=1e-5)
2613  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(var.data).mean(), 1, delta=1e-5)
2614 
2615  # check that eval mode doesn't change behavior
2616  grad_out = torch.randn_like(output)
2617  res1 = output.data.clone()
2618  output.backward(grad_out)
2619  grad1 = input_var.grad.data.clone()
2620 
2621  IN.eval()
2622  output = IN(input_var)
2623  input_var.grad = None
2624  output.backward(grad_out)
2625  res2 = output.data
2626  grad2 = input_var.grad.data
2627  self.assertEqual(res1, res2)
2628  self.assertEqual(grad1, grad2)
2629 
2630  # If track_running_stats=True and momentum=1, running_mean/var should be
2631  # equal to mean/var of the input (with unbias correction)
2632  IN = cls(c, momentum=1, eps=0, track_running_stats=True).to(device, dtype)
2633 
2634  output = IN(input_var)
2635 
2636  input_reshaped = input_var.transpose(1, 0).reshape(c, -1)
2637  mean = input_reshaped.mean(1)
2638 
2639  input_reshaped = input_var.transpose(1, 0).reshape(c, b, -1)
2640  var = input_reshaped.var(2, unbiased=True)[:, :]
2641 
2642  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(mean.data - IN.running_mean).mean(), 0, delta=1e-5)
2643  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(var.data.mean(1) - IN.running_var).mean(), 0, delta=1e-5)
2644 
2645  # in eval mode, adding X * std to a channel in input should make the
2646  # corresponding channel in output have mean X
2647  IN.eval()
2648  delta = IN.running_var.sqrt() * torch.arange(c, device=device, dtype=dtype)
2649  delta = delta.view(-1, *[1 for _ in range(2, input.dim())])
2650  output = IN(input_var + delta)
2651  self.assertEqual(output.transpose(0, 1).reshape(c, -1).mean(1), torch.arange(c))
2652 
2653  def _test_InstanceNorm_cuda_half(self, cls, input):
2654  # THNN
2655  input = Variable(input.cuda().half().random_(1, 10), requires_grad=True)
2656  m = cls(input.size(1), affine=True, track_running_stats=True).to("cuda", torch.half)
2657  thnn_output = m(input)
2658  thnn_output.sum().backward()
2659  thnn_input_grad = input.grad.data.clone()
2660  self.assertEqual(thnn_output.type(), input.type())
2661  # cuDNN
2662  if TEST_CUDNN:
2663  input.grad = None
2664  m = m.float()
2665  cudnn_output = m(input)
2666  cudnn_output.sum().backward()
2667  cudnn_input_grad = input.grad.data.clone()
2668  self.assertEqual(cudnn_output.type(), input.type())
2669  self.assertAlmostEqual(cudnn_output, thnn_output, delta=1e-4)
2670  self.assertAlmostEqual(cudnn_input_grad, thnn_input_grad, delta=1e-3)
2671 
2672  def test_InstanceNorm1d_general(self):
2673  b = random.randint(3, 5)
2674  c = random.randint(3, 5)
2675  d = random.randint(8, 10)
2676 
2677  input = torch.rand(b, c, d)
2678  self._test_InstanceNorm_general(nn.InstanceNorm1d, input, dtype=torch.float)
2679 
2680  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2681  def test_InstanceNorm1d_general_cuda(self):
2682  b = random.randint(3, 5)
2683  c = random.randint(3, 5)
2684  d = random.randint(8, 10)
2685 
2686  input = torch.rand(b, c, d)
2687  self._test_InstanceNorm_general(nn.InstanceNorm1d, input, "cuda", torch.float)
2688  self._test_InstanceNorm_cuda_half(nn.InstanceNorm1d, input)
2689 
2690  def test_InstanceNorm2d_general(self):
2691  b = random.randint(3, 5)
2692  c = random.randint(3, 5)
2693  w = random.randint(3, 6)
2694  h = random.randint(6, 8)
2695 
2696  input = torch.rand(b, c, h, w)
2697  self._test_InstanceNorm_general(nn.InstanceNorm2d, input, dtype=torch.float)
2698 
2699  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2700  def test_InstanceNorm2d_general_cuda(self):
2701  b = random.randint(3, 5)
2702  c = random.randint(3, 5)
2703  w = random.randint(3, 6)
2704  h = random.randint(6, 8)
2705 
2706  input = torch.rand(b, c, h, w)
2707  self._test_InstanceNorm_general(nn.InstanceNorm2d, input, "cuda", torch.float)
2708  self._test_InstanceNorm_cuda_half(nn.InstanceNorm2d, input)
2709 
2710  def test_InstanceNorm3d_general(self):
2711  b = random.randint(3, 5)
2712  c = random.randint(3, 5)
2713  w = random.randint(2, 5)
2714  h = random.randint(2, 5)
2715  d = random.randint(2, 5)
2716 
2717  input = torch.rand(b, c, h, w, d)
2718  self._test_InstanceNorm_general(nn.InstanceNorm3d, input, dtype=torch.float)
2719 
2720  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2721  @skipIfRocm
2722  def test_InstanceNorm3d_general_cuda(self):
2723  b = random.randint(3, 5)
2724  c = random.randint(2, 5)
2725  w = random.randint(2, 5)
2726  h = random.randint(2, 5)
2727  d = random.randint(2, 5)
2728 
2729  input = torch.rand(b, c, h, w, d)
2730  self._test_InstanceNorm_general(nn.InstanceNorm3d, input, "cuda", torch.float)
2731  self._test_InstanceNorm_cuda_half(nn.InstanceNorm3d, input)
2732 
2733  def _test_LayerNorm_general(self, device="cpu", dtype=torch.float):
2734  for i in range(2, 6):
2735  shape = torch.randint(3, 6, (i,), dtype=torch.long).tolist()
2736  x = torch.empty(*shape, device=device, dtype=dtype).uniform_(0, 10)
2737  normalized_ndim = random.randint(1, i - 1) # inclusive
2738  normalized_shape = shape[-normalized_ndim:]
2739  unnormalized_shape = shape[:-normalized_ndim]
2740 
2741  # test that LN normalizes to mean 0 and stddev 1
2742  ln = nn.LayerNorm(normalized_shape, eps=0).to(device, dtype)
2743  ln.weight.data.fill_(1)
2744  ln.bias.data.fill_(0)
2745  output = ln(x)
2746  out_reshaped = output.view(*(unnormalized_shape + [-1]))
2747  mean = out_reshaped.mean(-1)
2748  var = out_reshaped.var(-1, unbiased=False)
2749  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(mean.data).mean(), 0, delta=1e-5)
2750  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(var.data).mean(), 1, delta=1e-5)
2751 
2752  # test that LN applies weight and bias correctly
2753  scale, bias = torch.empty(2).uniform_(0.2, 2).tolist()
2754  ln.weight.data.fill_(scale)
2755  ln.bias.data.fill_(bias)
2756  output = ln(x)
2757  out_reshaped = output.view(*(unnormalized_shape + [-1]))
2758  mean = out_reshaped.mean(-1)
2759  var = out_reshaped.var(-1, unbiased=False)
2760  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(mean.data).mean(), bias, delta=1e-5)
2761  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(var.data).mean(), scale ** 2, delta=1e-5)
2762 
2763  bad_norm_shape_input_shape = {
2764  (): (),
2765  (2, 3): (3,),
2766  (2,): (1, 2, 3),
2767  (10,): (2, 3),
2768  10: (2, 3),
2769  }
2770  for norm_shape, input_shape in bad_norm_shape_input_shape.items():
2771  ln = nn.LayerNorm(norm_shape)
2772  input = torch.empty(input_shape, device=device, dtype=dtype).uniform_(0, 10)
2773  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: ln(input))
2774 
2775  def _test_LayerNorm_cuda_half(self):
2776  input = Variable(torch.empty(2, 3, 3, 2).to("cuda", torch.half).random_(1, 10), requires_grad=True)
2777  m = nn.LayerNorm([3, 2]).to("cuda", torch.half)
2778  output = m(input)
2779  output.sum().backward()
2780  self.assertEqual(output.type(), input.type())
2781 
2782  def test_LayerNorm_general(self):
2783  self._test_LayerNorm_general()
2784 
2785  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2786  def test_LayerNorm_general_cuda(self):
2787  self._test_LayerNorm_general("cuda")
2788  self._test_LayerNorm_cuda_half()
2789 
2790  def _test_GroupNorm_general(self, device="cpu", dtype=torch.float):
2791  good_shape_g = {
2792  (1, 2, 3, 4): 2,
2793  (2, 3, 10): 3,
2794  (3, 1, 1, 1, 2): 1,
2795  (2, 6, 4, 2, 2): 3,
2796  }
2797  for shape, g in good_shape_g.items():
2798  x = torch.empty(*shape, device=device, dtype=dtype).uniform_(0, 10)
2799  b = shape[0]
2800  c = shape[1]
2801 
2802  # test that GN normalizes to mean 0 and stddev 1
2803  gn = nn.GroupNorm(g, c, eps=0).to(device, dtype)
2804  gn.weight.data.fill_(1)
2805  gn.bias.data.fill_(0)
2806  output = gn(x)
2807  out_reshaped = output.view(b, g, -1)
2808  mean = out_reshaped.mean(-1)
2809  var = out_reshaped.var(-1, unbiased=False)
2810  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(mean).mean(), 0, delta=1e-5)
2811  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(var).mean(), 1, delta=1e-5)
2812 
2813  # test that GN applies weight and bias correctly
2814  scale = torch.empty(c, device=device, dtype=dtype).uniform_(0.2, 2)
2815  bias = torch.empty(c, device=device, dtype=dtype).uniform_(0.2, 2)
2816  gn.weight.data.copy_(scale)
2817  gn.bias.data.copy_(bias)
2818  output = gn(x)
2819  out_reshaped = output.view(b, c, -1)
2820  out_normed = (out_reshaped - bias.view(c, 1)) / scale.view(c, 1)
2821  out_normed_reshaped = out_normed.view(b, g, -1)
2822  mean = out_normed_reshaped.mean(-1)
2823  var = out_normed_reshaped.var(-1, unbiased=False)
2824  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(mean).mean(), 0, delta=1e-5)
2825  self.assertAlmostEqual(torch.abs(var).mean(), 1, delta=1e-5)
2826 
2827  bad_shape_g = {
2828  (1, 2, 3, 4): 3,
2829  (2, 3, 10): 2,
2830  (3, 1, 1, 1, 2): 10,
2831  (2, 6, 4, 2, 2): 4,
2832  }
2833  for shape, g in bad_shape_g.items():
2834  gn = nn.GroupNorm(g, shape[1])
2835  input = torch.empty(*shape, device=device, dtype=dtype).uniform_(0, 10)
2836  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: gn(input))
2837 
2838  def _test_GroupNorm_cuda_half(self):
2839  input = Variable(torch.empty(2, 3, 3, 2).to("cuda", torch.half).random_(1, 10), requires_grad=True)
2840  input = torch.zeros(2, 4, 3, 2, requires_grad=True).cuda().half().random_(1, 10)
2841  m = nn.GroupNorm(2, 4).to("cuda", torch.half)
2842  output = m(input)
2843  output.sum().backward()
2844  self.assertEqual(output.type(), input.type())
2845 
2846  def test_GroupNorm_general(self):
2847  self._test_GroupNorm_general(dtype=torch.float)
2848 
2849  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2850  def test_GroupNorm_general_cuda(self):
2851  self._test_GroupNorm_general("cuda", torch.float)
2852  self._test_GroupNorm_cuda_half()
2853 
2854  def test_pad(self):
2855  inputs = torch.randn(1, 3, 4, 4, requires_grad=True)
2856  _assertGradAndGradgradChecks(self, lambda x: F.pad(x, (1, 1, 1, 1)), (inputs,))
2857  _assertGradAndGradgradChecks(self, lambda x: F.pad(x, (-1, 1, -2, 1)), (inputs,))
2858  _assertGradAndGradgradChecks(self, lambda x: F.pad(x, (-1, 1, -2, 1), value=2), (inputs,))
2859  self.assertTrue(gradcheck(lambda x: F.pad(x, (-1, 1, -2, 1), mode='replicate'), (inputs,)))
2860  self.assertTrue(gradcheck(lambda x: F.pad(x, (-1, 1, -2, 1), mode='reflect'), (inputs,)))
2861 
2862  inputs = torch.randn(1, 2, 3, 4, 4, requires_grad=True)
2863  self.assertTrue(gradcheck(lambda x: F.pad(x, (1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1), mode='replicate'), (inputs,)))
2864 
2865  # assert that relfection padding errors when pad >= input size
2866  expected_err_msg = r"Padding size should be less than the corresponding input dimension"
2867  self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError, expected_err_msg,
2868  lambda: F.pad(torch.randn(1, 1, 2, 3), (1, 1, 3, 0), mode='reflect'))
2869  self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError, expected_err_msg,
2870  lambda: F.pad(torch.randn(1, 1, 2), (2, 1), mode='reflect'))
2871 
2872  @staticmethod
2873  def _test_one_hot(self, use_cuda=False):
2874  device = torch.device('cuda' if use_cuda else 'cpu')
2875  with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError):
2876  torch.nn.functional.one_hot(torch.tensor([3, 4, -1, 0], device=device), -1)
2877 
2878  with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError):
2879  torch.nn.functional.one_hot(torch.tensor([3, 4, 1, 0], device=device), 3)
2880 
2881  t = torch.nn.functional.one_hot(torch.tensor([3, 4, 1, 0], device=device))
2882  expected = torch.tensor([[0, 0, 0, 1, 0],
2883  [0, 0, 0, 0, 1],
2884  [0, 1, 0, 0, 0],
2885  [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]], device=device)
2886  self.assertEqual(t, expected)
2887 
2888  t = torch.nn.functional.one_hot(torch.tensor([3, 4, 1, 0], device=device), -1)
2889  expected = torch.tensor([[0, 0, 0, 1, 0],
2890  [0, 0, 0, 0, 1],
2891  [0, 1, 0, 0, 0],
2892  [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]], device=device)
2893  self.assertEqual(t, expected)
2894 
2895  t = torch.nn.functional.one_hot(torch.tensor([3, 4, 1, 0], device=device), 6)
2896  expected = torch.tensor([[0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0],
2897  [0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0],
2898  [0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0],
2899  [1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]], device=device)
2900  self.assertEqual(t, expected)
2901 
2902  t = torch.nn.functional.one_hot(torch.tensor([[3, 4], [1, 0]], device=device))
2903  expected = torch.tensor([[[0, 0, 0, 1, 0],
2904  [0, 0, 0, 0, 1]],
2905  [[0, 1, 0, 0, 0],
2906  [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]]], device=device)
2907  self.assertEqual(t, expected)
2908 
2909  t = torch.nn.functional.one_hot(torch.tensor(4, device=device))
2910  expected = torch.tensor([0, 0, 0, 0, 1], device=device)
2911  self.assertEqual(t, expected)
2912 
2913  t = torch.nn.functional.one_hot(torch.empty([4, 0], dtype=torch.long, device=device), 100)
2914  expected = torch.empty([4, 0, 100])
2915  self.assertEqual(t, expected)
2916 
2917  with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError):
2918  torch.nn.functional.one_hot(torch.empty([4, 0], dtype=torch.long, device=device))
2919 
2920  with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError):
2921  torch.nn.functional.one_hot(torch.tensor([3, 4, 1, 0], device=device), -2)
2922 
2923  def test_one_hot(self):
2924  self._test_one_hot(self)
2925 
2926  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
2927  def test_one_hot_cuda(self):
2928  self._test_one_hot(self, use_cuda=True)
2929 
2930  def test_pad_scalar_error(self):
2931  inputs = torch.tensor(0., requires_grad=True)
2932  self.assertRaises(AssertionError, lambda: F.pad(inputs, (1, 1)))
2933  self.assertRaises(AssertionError, lambda: F.pad(inputs, (1,)))
2934 
2935  def test_nn_scalars(self):
2936  # One off tests to ensure scalars from nn.yaml are properly applied
2937  def verify_scalars(input, output):
2938  if input.dim() == 0:
2939  self.assertEqual((), output.shape)
2940  else:
2941  self.assertNotEqual((), output.shape)
2942  output.sum().backward()
2943  self.assertEqual(input.shape, input.grad.shape)
2944 
2945  devices = ['cpu'] if not torch.cuda.is_available() else ['cpu', 'cuda']
2946  for device in devices:
2947  for input_shape in [(5, 6), ()]:
2948  for module in [torch.nn.ELU, torch.nn.Hardtanh, torch.nn.LeakyReLU, torch.nn.LogSigmoid,
2949  torch.nn.RReLU, torch.nn.Softshrink, torch.nn.Softplus, torch.nn.Sigmoid,
2950  torch.nn.Tanh]:
2951  input = torch.randn(input_shape, device=device, requires_grad=True)
2952  m = module()
2953  output = m(input)
2954  verify_scalars(input, output)
2955 
2956  def test_nn_scalars_reductions(self):
2957  # One off tests to ensure scalars from nn.yaml are properly applied
2958  def verify_reduction_scalars(input, reduction, output):
2959  if reduction != 'none' or input.dim() == 0:
2960  self.assertEqual((), output.shape)
2961  else:
2962  self.assertNotEqual((), output.shape)
2963  output.sum().backward()
2964  self.assertEqual(input.shape, input.grad.shape)
2965 
2966  devices = ['cpu'] if not torch.cuda.is_available() else ['cpu', 'cuda']
2967  for device in devices:
2968  for input_shape in [(5, 6), ()]:
2969  for reduction in ['none', 'mean', 'sum']:
2970  for module in [torch.nn.BCELoss, torch.nn.L1Loss, torch.nn.MSELoss,
2971  torch.nn.SmoothL1Loss, torch.nn.SoftMarginLoss]:
2972  input = torch.randn(input_shape, device=device, requires_grad=True)
2973  target = torch.empty(input_shape, device=device).random_(2)
2974  sigmoid = nn.Sigmoid()
2975 
2976  input = torch.randn(input_shape, device=device, requires_grad=True)
2977  m = module(reduction=reduction)
2978  output = m(sigmoid(input), target)
2979  verify_reduction_scalars(input, reduction, output)
2980 
2981  def test_normalize(self):
2982  inputs = torch.randn(1, 3, 4, 4, requires_grad=True)
2983  self.assertTrue(gradcheck(lambda x: F.normalize(x, p=1, dim=-1), (inputs,)))
2984  self.assertTrue(gradcheck(lambda x: F.normalize(x, p=2, dim=-2), (inputs,)))
2985 
2986  inputs = torch.randn((), requires_grad=True)
2987  self.assertTrue(gradcheck(lambda x: F.normalize(x, p=1, dim=-1), (inputs,)))
2988 
2989  def _test_maxpool_indices(self, num_dim, adaptive=False, device="cpu", dtype=torch.float):
2990  def expected_indices(dim):
2991  if dim == 1:
2992  return torch.tensor([1, 3], dtype=torch.double).repeat(2, 2, 1)
2993  if dim == 2:
2994  return torch.tensor([[5, 7], [13, 15]], dtype=torch.double).repeat(2, 2, 1, 1)
2995 
2996  def expected_grad(dim):
2997  if dim == 1:
2998  return torch.tensor([0, 1, 0, 1], dtype=torch.double).repeat(2, 2, 1)
2999  grad = expected_grad(dim - 1)
3000  zero = torch.zeros(grad.size())
3001  return torch.stack((zero, grad, zero, grad), 2)
3002 
3003  def expected_output(dim):
3004  if dim == 1:
3005  return torch.arange(2, 17, 2).view(2, 2, 2)
3006  if dim == 2:
3007  col = torch.arange(6, 63, 8)
3008  return torch.stack([col, col + 2], 1).view(2, 2, 2, 2)
3009 
3010  if adaptive:
3011  cls_name = 'AdaptiveMaxPool{}d'.format(num_dim)
3012  else:
3013  cls_name = 'MaxPool{}d'.format(num_dim)
3014  module_cls = getattr(nn, cls_name)
3015  module = module_cls(2, return_indices=True).to(device, dtype=dtype)
3016  numel = 4 ** (num_dim + 1)
3017  input = torch.arange(1, numel + 1).view(2, 2, *repeat(4, num_dim)).to(device, dtype=dtype)
3018  input_var = input.clone().detach().requires_grad_()
3019 
3020  # Check forward
3021  output, indices = module(input_var)
3022  if num_dim != 3:
3023  expected_indices = expected_indices(num_dim)
3024  expected_output = expected_output(num_dim)
3025  self.assertEqual(indices.dim(), input.dim())
3026  self.assertEqual(indices.data.squeeze(), expected_indices)
3027  self.assertEqual(output.data.squeeze(), expected_output)
3028  self.assertTrue(output.requires_grad)
3029  self.assertFalse(indices.requires_grad)
3030 
3031  # Make sure backward works
3032  grad_output = torch.ones(output.size(), device=device, dtype=dtype)
3033  output.backward(grad_output, retain_graph=True)
3034  expected_grad = expected_grad(num_dim)
3035  self.assertEqual(input_var.grad.data, expected_grad.view_as(input))
3036 
3037  # Make sure backward after changing indices will result in an error
3038  indices.add_(1)
3039  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: output.backward(grad_output))
3040 
3041  def test_adaptive_pooling_input_size(self):
3042  for numel in (2, 3):
3043  for pool_type in ('Max', 'Avg'):
3044  cls_name = 'Adaptive{}Pool{}d'.format(pool_type, numel)
3045  module_cls = getattr(nn, cls_name)
3046  output_size = (2,) * numel
3047  module = module_cls(output_size)
3048 
3049  input = torch.randn(output_size)
3050  self.assertRaises(ValueError, lambda: module(input))
3051 
3052  def test_adaptive_pooling_size_none(self):
3053  for numel in (2, 3):
3054  for pool_type in ('Max', 'Avg'):
3055  cls_name = 'Adaptive{}Pool{}d'.format(pool_type, numel)
3056  module_cls = getattr(nn, cls_name)
3057  output_size = (2,) * (numel - 1) + (None,)
3058  module = module_cls(output_size)
3059 
3060  input = torch.randn((4,) * (numel + 1))
3061  output = module(input)
3062  self.assertEqual(output.size(), (4,) + (2,) * (numel - 1) + (4,))
3063

3065  self._test_Conv2d_naive_groups()

3151 
3152  @staticmethod
3153  def _test_max_pool_nan(self, device, dtype=torch.float):
3154  for adaptive in ['', 'adaptive_']:
3155  for num_dim in [1, 2, 3]:
3156  fn_name = '{}max_pool{}d'.format(adaptive, num_dim)
3157  fn = getattr(F, fn_name)
3158  x = torch.full([1, 1] + num_dim * [3], nan)
3159  res = fn(x, 1 if adaptive else 3)
3160  self.assertTrue(math.isnan(res.item()))
3161 
3162  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
3163  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
3164  def test_max_pool_nan_cuda(self, dtype=torch.float):
3165  self._test_max_pool_nan(self, device="cuda", dtype=dtype)
3166 
3167  def test_max_pool_nan(self, dtype=torch.float):
3168  self._test_max_pool_nan(self, device="cpu")
3169 
3170  @staticmethod
3171  def _test_pool_large_size(self, device, dtype=torch.float):
3172  for op in ('max', 'avg'):
3173  for num_dim in [1, 2, 3]:
3174  fn_name = '{}_pool{}d'.format(op, num_dim)
3175  fn = getattr(F, fn_name)
3176  # 16777217 is the smallest integer not expressible in float32
3177  x = torch.ones([1, 1, 16777217] + (num_dim - 1) * [1],
3178  device=device, dtype=dtype)
3179  res = fn(x, 1, stride=1, padding=0)
3180  # check if the output shape was still computed correctly
3181  self.assertEqual(x.shape[2], res.shape[2])
3182 
3183  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
3184  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
3185  def test_pool_large_size_cuda(self, dtype=torch.float):
3186  self._test_pool_large_size(self, device="cuda", dtype=dtype)
3187 
3188  def test_pool_large_size(self, dtype=torch.float):
3189  self._test_pool_large_size(self, device="cpu")
3190 
3191  def _test_scatter(self, tensor):
3192  x = tensor.detach().requires_grad_()
3193  result = dp.scatter(x, (0, 1))
3194  self.assertEqual(len(result), 2)
3195  self.assertEqual(result[0], x[:2])
3196  self.assertEqual(result[0].get_device(), 0)
3197  self.assertEqual(result[1], x[2:])
3198  self.assertEqual(result[1].get_device(), 1)
3199  grad = result[0].data.clone().fill_(2)
3200  result[0].backward(grad)
3201  self.assertEqual(x.grad.data[:2], grad)
3202  self.assertEqual(x.grad.data[2:], grad.clone().zero_())
3203  _assertGradAndGradgradChecks(self, lambda y: dp.scatter(y, (0, 1)), (x,))
3204 
3205  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3206  @skipIfRocm
3207  def test_scatter_cpu(self):
3208  self._test_scatter(torch.randn(4, 4))
3209 
3210  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3211  def test_scatter_gpu(self):
3212  self._test_scatter(torch.randn(4, 4).cuda())
3213 
3214  def _test_gather(self, output_device):
3215  inputs = (
3216  torch.randn(2, 4, device='cuda:0', requires_grad=True),
3217  torch.randn(2, 4, device='cuda:1', requires_grad=True),
3218  )
3219  result = dp.gather(inputs, output_device)
3220  self.assertEqual(result.size(), torch.Size([4, 4]))
3221  self.assertEqual(result[:2], inputs[0])
3222  self.assertEqual(result[2:], inputs[1])
3223  if output_device != -1:
3224  self.assertEqual(result.get_device(), output_device)
3225  else:
3226  self.assertFalse(result.is_cuda)
3227  grad = torch.randn(4, 4)
3228  if output_device != -1:
3229  grad = grad.cuda(output_device)
3230  result.backward(grad)
3231  self.assertEqual(inputs[0].grad.data, grad[:2])
3232  self.assertEqual(inputs[1].grad.data, grad[2:])
3233  _assertGradAndGradgradChecks(self, lambda x, y: dp.gather((x, y), output_device), inputs)
3234 
3235  # test scalar inputs, should stack into a vector in this case
3236  inputs = (
3237  torch.randn((), device='cuda:0', requires_grad=True),
3238  torch.randn((), device='cuda:1', requires_grad=True),
3239  )
3240  result = dp.gather(inputs, output_device)
3241  self.assertEqual(result.size(), torch.Size([2]))
3242  self.assertEqual(result[0], inputs[0])
3243  self.assertEqual(result[1], inputs[1])
3244  if output_device != -1:
3245  self.assertEqual(result.get_device(), output_device)
3246  else:
3247  self.assertFalse(result.is_cuda)
3248  grad = torch.randn(2)
3249  if output_device != -1:
3250  grad = grad.cuda(output_device)
3251  result.backward(grad)
3252  self.assertEqual(inputs[0].grad, grad[0])
3253  self.assertEqual(inputs[1].grad, grad[1])
3254  _assertGradAndGradgradChecks(self, lambda x, y: dp.gather((x, y), output_device), inputs)
3255 
3256  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3257  @skipIfRocm
3258  def test_gather_cpu(self):
3259  self._test_gather(-1)
3260 
3261  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3262  def test_gather_gpu(self):
3263  self._test_gather(0)
3264 
3265  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3266  def test_gather_different_len_dicts(self):
3267  inputs = (
3268  {'a': Variable(torch.randn(1, 2).cuda(0), requires_grad=True)},
3269  {
3270  'b': Variable(torch.randn(1, 2).cuda(1), requires_grad=True),
3271  'a': Variable(torch.randn(1, 2).cuda(1), requires_grad=True)
3272  }
3273  )
3274  with self.assertRaises(ValueError):
3275  _ = dp.gather(inputs, target_device=0)
3276 
3277  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3278  @skipIfRocm
3279  def test_broadcast_double_backwards_gpu(self):
3280  tensors = (torch.randn(4, 4, device='cuda', requires_grad=True),
3281  torch.randn(4, 4, device='cuda', requires_grad=True),
3282  torch.randn(4, 4, device='cuda', requires_grad=True))
3283  _assertGradAndGradgradChecks(self, lambda *i: Broadcast.apply((0, 1), *i), tensors)
3284 
3285  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3286  def test_broadcast_not_requiring_grad(self):
3287  variables = [
3288  torch.randn(1, 2, device='cuda', requires_grad=True),
3289  torch.randn(1, 2, device='cuda', requires_grad=False),
3290  torch.randn(1, 2, device='cuda', requires_grad=False),
3291  torch.randn(1, 2, device='cuda', requires_grad=True),
3292  torch.randn(1, 2, device='cuda', requires_grad=True),
3293  ]
3294  broadcasted_variables = Broadcast.apply((0, 1), *variables)
3295  for output_idx, broadcasted_var in enumerate(broadcasted_variables):
3296  input_var = variables[output_idx % len(variables)]
3297  self.assertEqual(input_var.requires_grad, broadcasted_var.requires_grad)
3298 
3299  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3300  def test_broadcast_no_grad(self):
3301  x = torch.randn(1, 2, dtype=torch.float32, requires_grad=True, device='cuda')
3302  with torch.no_grad():
3303  broadcasted = Broadcast.apply((0, 1), x)
3304  self.assertTrue(x.requires_grad)
3305  for output in broadcasted:
3306  self.assertFalse(output.requires_grad)
3307 
3308  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3309  def test_replicate(self):
3310  module = nn.Linear(10, 5).float().cuda()
3311  input = Variable(torch.randn(2, 10).float().cuda())
3312  expected_output = module(input).data
3313  replicas = dp.replicate(module, (0, 1))
3314  for i, replica in enumerate(replicas):
3315  for p in replica.parameters():
3316  self.assertEqual(p.get_device(), i)
3317  replica_input = input.cuda(i)
3318  self.assertEqual(replica(replica_input).data, expected_output)
3319 
3320  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3321  def test_replicate_buffers(self):
3322  net = nn.Module()
3323  net.bn = nn.BatchNorm2d(10)
3324  net.cuda()
3325  replicas = dp.replicate(net, (0, 1))
3326  for i, replica in enumerate(replicas):
3327  self.assertEqual(replica.bn.running_mean.get_device(), i, 'buffer on wrong device')
3328  self.assertEqual(replica.bn.running_var.get_device(), i, 'buffer on wrong device')
3329  self.assertEqual(replica.bn.num_batches_tracked.get_device(), i, 'buffer on wrong device')
3330 
3331  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3332  @skipIfRocm
3333  def test_data_parallel_buffers_requiring_grad(self):
3334  class TestModule(nn.Module):
3335  def __init__(self, t):
3336  super(TestModule, self).__init__()
3337  self.register_buffer('t_rg', t)
3338  self.register_buffer('t_not_rg', t.clone().detach())
3339 
3340  def forward(self, x):
3341  return x * self.t_rg + self.t_not_rg
3342 
3343  m = TestModule(torch.randn(100, device='cuda', requires_grad=True))
3344  self.assertTrue(m.t_rg.requires_grad)
3345 
3346  dpm = nn.DataParallel(m, [0, 1])
3347  inp = torch.randn(2, 100, device='cuda')
3348 
3349  def fn(t):
3350  return dpm(inp)
3351 
3352  torch.autograd.gradcheck(fn, (m.t_rg,))
3353 
3354  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3355  def test_parallel_apply(self):
3356  l1 = nn.Linear(10, 5).to("cuda:0", torch.float)
3357  l2 = nn.Linear(10, 5).to("cuda:1", torch.float)
3358  i1 = torch.randn(2, 10, device="cuda:0", dtype=torch.float)
3359  i2 = torch.randn(2, 10, device="cuda:1", dtype=torch.float)
3360  expected1 = l1(i1).data
3361  expected2 = l2(i2).data
3362  modules = (l1, l2)
3363  expected_outputs = (expected1, expected2)
3364 
3365  # each input can be either a collection of positional arguments
3366  # or an object representing the single argument
3367  for inputs in [((i1,), (i2,)), (i1, i2)]:
3368  outputs = dp.parallel_apply(modules, inputs, None)
3369  for out, expected in zip(outputs, expected_outputs):
3370  self.assertEqual(out.data, expected)
3371 
3372  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3373  @skipIfRocm
3374  def test_data_parallel_multiple_input(self):
3375  class TestModule(nn.Module):
3376 
3377  def forward(self, var1, var2, float1, var3=None):
3378  if var3 is None:
3379  return float1 * (var1 * var2)
3380  else:
3381  return float1 * (var1 * var2 + var3)
3382 
3383  m = TestModule()
3384  var1 = torch.randn(5, 5, dtype=torch.float, requires_grad=True)
3385  var2 = torch.randn(5, 5, dtype=torch.float, requires_grad=True)
3386  var3 = torch.randn(5, 5, dtype=torch.float, requires_grad=False)
3387 
3388  float1 = torch.randn(1).item()
3389 
3390  expected = m(var1, var2, float1)
3391  loss = expected.sum()
3392  loss.backward()
3393  gvar1_exp = var1.grad.clone()
3394  gvar2_exp = var2.grad.clone()
3395 
3396  def local_test(out):
3397  var1.grad.data.fill_(0.0)
3398  var2.grad.data.fill_(0.0)
3399  loss = out.sum()
3400  loss.backward()
3401  self.assertEqual(out, expected)
3402  self.assertEqual(gvar1_exp, var1.grad)
3403  self.assertEqual(gvar2_exp, var2.grad)
3404 
3405  out = dp.data_parallel(m, (var1, var2, float1), (0, 1))
3406  local_test(out)
3407 
3408  out = dp.data_parallel(m, (var1, var2, float1), (1, 0))
3409  local_test(out)
3410 
3411  out = dp.data_parallel(m, (var1, var2, float1), (0,))
3412  local_test(out)
3413 
3414  var1.grad.data.fill_(0.0)
3415  var2.grad.data.fill_(0.0)
3416  expected = m(var1, var2, float1, var3=var3)
3417  loss = expected.sum()
3418  loss.backward()
3419  gvar1_exp = var1.grad.clone()
3420  gvar2_exp = var2.grad.clone()
3421 
3422  dpm = nn.DataParallel(TestModule())
3423  out = dpm(var1, var2, float1, var3=var3)
3424  local_test(out)
3425 
3426  dpm = nn.DataParallel(TestModule(), device_ids=[0])
3427  out = dpm(var1, var2, float1, var3=var3)
3428  local_test(out)
3429 
3430  kwarg_wrap = {'var3': var3}
3431  out = dp.data_parallel(
3432  m, (var1, var2, float1), (0, 1), module_kwargs=kwarg_wrap)
3433  local_test(out)
3434 
3435  out = dp.data_parallel(
3436  m, (var1, var2, float1), (0,), module_kwargs=kwarg_wrap)
3437  local_test(out)
3438 
3439  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3440  def test_data_parallel_small_back(self):
3441  l = nn.Linear(10, 5).float().cuda()
3442  i = Variable(torch.randn(20, 10).float().cuda())
3443  out = dp.data_parallel(l, i, (0, 1))
3444  self.assertEqual(out, l(i))
3445 
3446  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3447  @skipIfRocm
3448  def test_data_parallel_model_device(self):
3449  r"""Test device[0] check at forward time.
3450  """
3451  l = nn.Linear(2, 2)
3452  inp = torch.randn(2, 2)
3453  inp_cuda0 = inp.cuda(0)
3454  inp_cuda1 = inp.cuda(1)
3455 
3456  error_msg = "module must have its parameters and buffers on device {}"
3457 
3458  @contextlib.contextmanager
3459  def dummy_ctx_manager():
3460  yield
3461 
3462  def test(inner_m, dp_device, inp, device_ids, should_fail):
3463  if device_ids is None:
3464  device_ids = list(range(torch.cuda.device_count()))
3465 
3466  if isinstance(device_ids[0], torch.device):
3467  expect_device = device_ids[0]
3468  else:
3469  expect_device = torch.device("cuda:{}".format(device_ids[0]))
3470 
3471  if should_fail:
3472  def assert_correct():
3473  return self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError, error_msg.format(expect_device))
3474  else:
3475  assert_correct = dummy_ctx_manager
3476 
3477  # test DataParallel module
3478  dpm = nn.DataParallel(inner_m, device_ids)
3479  if dp_device is not None:
3480  dpm = dpm.to(dp_device)
3481 
3482  with assert_correct():
3483  dpm(inp)
3484 
3485  # test functional
3486  with assert_correct():
3487  nn.parallel.data_parallel(inner_m.to(dp_device), inp, device_ids)
3488 
3489  test(l.to('cpu'), None, inp, None, should_fail=True)
3490  test(l.cuda(1), None, inp_cuda0, None, should_fail=True)
3491  test(l.cuda(), None, inp_cuda0, [1, 0], should_fail=True)
3492 
3493  test(l.cuda(), None, inp_cuda0, None, should_fail=False)
3494  test(l.cpu(), 'cuda', inp_cuda0, None, should_fail=False)
3495  test(l.cuda(1), None, inp_cuda1, [1, 0], should_fail=False)
3496  test(l.cpu(), 'cuda:1', inp_cuda1, [1, 0], should_fail=False)
3497 
3498  s = nn.Sequential(l.cpu())
3499  test(s, None, inp, None, should_fail=True)
3500  test(s, None, inp, [0, 1], should_fail=True)
3501  test(s, None, inp, [1, 0], should_fail=True)
3502 
3503  s = nn.Sequential(deepcopy(l).cpu(), l.cuda())
3504  test(s, None, inp, None, should_fail=True)
3505  test(s, None, inp, [0, 1], should_fail=True)
3506  test(s, None, inp, [1, 0], should_fail=True)
3507 
3508  s = nn.Sequential(l.cuda(), deepcopy(l).cuda(1))
3509  test(s, None, inp, None, should_fail=True)
3510  test(s, None, inp, [0, 1], should_fail=True)
3511  test(s, None, inp, [1, 0], should_fail=True)
3512 
3513  s = nn.Sequential(l.cuda(), deepcopy(l).cuda())
3514  test(s, None, inp, None, should_fail=False)
3515  test(s, None, inp, [0, 1], should_fail=False)
3516  test(s, None, inp, [1, 0], should_fail=True)
3517  test(s.cpu(), None, inp, [1, 0], should_fail=True)
3518  test(s.cuda(1), None, inp, [1, 0], should_fail=False)
3519 
3520  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU or not PY3, "multi-GPU not supported")
3521  @skipIfRocm
3522  def test_data_parallel_model_no_refcycles(self):
3523  # Python 2.7 will create reference cycles with the following
3524  # Module on multiple GPUs, but Python 3 shouldn't unless
3525  # there are refcycles on the PyTorch side (or the defined module)
3526  import gc
3527 
3528  class Model(nn.Module):
3529  def __init__(self):
3530  super(Model, self).__init__()
3531  self.linear = nn.Linear(1, 1)
3532 
3533  def forward(self, x):
3534  return self.linear(x)
3535 
3536  gc.collect()
3537  model = nn.DataParallel(Model().cuda())
3538  data = Variable(torch.randn(1).cuda())
3539  model(data)
3540 
3541  refcycles = gc.collect()
3542  self.assertEqual(refcycles, 0)
3543 
3544  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3545  def test_data_parallel_no_grad(self):
3546  test = self
3547 
3548  class Layer(nn.Module):
3549  def forward(self, x):
3550  test.assertFalse(torch.is_grad_enabled())
3551  return x
3552 
3553  l = Layer()
3554  i = Variable(torch.randn(20, 10).float().cuda())
3555  with torch.no_grad():
3556  dp.data_parallel(l, i, (0, 1))
3557  self.assertRaises(AssertionError, lambda: dp.data_parallel(l, i, (0, 1)))
3558 
3559  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3560  def test_data_parallel(self):
3561  l = nn.Linear(10, 5).float().cuda()
3562  i = Variable(torch.randn(20, 10).float().cuda(1))
3563  l.cuda(1)
3564  expected_out = l(i)
3565  loss = expected_out.sum()
3566  loss.backward()
3567  expected_grads = []
3568  for param in l.parameters():
3569  expected_grads.append(param.grad.clone())
3570  dev_ids_list = [(0, 1), (1, 0)]
3571  for dev_id in dev_ids_list:
3572  with torch.cuda.device(dev_id[0]):
3573  l.cuda()
3574  l.zero_grad()
3575  out = dp.data_parallel(l, i, dev_id)
3576  loss = out.sum()
3577  loss.backward()
3578  self.assertEqual(out.get_device(), dev_id[0])
3579  self.assertEqual(out.data, expected_out.data)
3580  for expected, param in zip(expected_grads, l.parameters()):
3581  self.assertEqual(param.grad.data, expected.data)
3582 
3583  # Check for None device_ids
3584  l = l.cuda()
3585  out = dp.data_parallel(l, i)
3586 
3587  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3588  @skipIfRocm
3589  def test_data_parallel_sparse(self):
3590  l = nn.Embedding(10, 5, sparse=True).to("cuda:1")
3591  i = torch.randint(10, (20, 5), device="cuda:1", dtype=torch.long)
3592  expected_out = l(i)
3593  loss = expected_out.sum()
3594  loss.backward()
3595  expected_grads = []
3596  for param in l.parameters():
3597  expected_grads.append(param.grad.clone())
3598  dev_ids_list = [(0, 1), (1, 0)]
3599  for dev_id in dev_ids_list:
3600  with torch.cuda.device(dev_id[0]):
3601  l.cuda()
3602  l.zero_grad()
3603  out = dp.data_parallel(l, i, dev_id)
3604  loss = out.sum()
3605  loss.backward()
3606  self.assertEqual(out.get_device(), dev_id[0])
3607  self.assertEqual(out.data, expected_out.data)
3608  for expected, param in zip(expected_grads, l.parameters()):
3609  self.assertEqual(param.grad.data, expected.data)
3610 
3611  # Check for None device_ids
3612  l = l.cuda()
3613  out = dp.data_parallel(l, i)
3614 
3615  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3616  def test_data_parallel_nested_output(self):
3617  def fn(input):
3618  return [
3619  input, (input.sin(), input.cos(), [input.add(1)]), input,
3620  OrderedDict(a=input, b=[input.sin()])
3621  ]
3622 
3623  class Net(nn.Module):
3624  def forward(self, input):
3625  return fn(input)
3626 
3627  i = torch.randn(2, 2).float().cuda(1)
3628  gpus = range(torch.cuda.device_count())
3629  output = dp.data_parallel(Net(), i, gpus)
3630  self.assertEqual(output, fn(i))
3631  self.assertIsInstance(output[0], torch.Tensor)
3632  self.assertIsInstance(output[1], tuple)
3633  self.assertIsInstance(output[1][0], torch.Tensor)
3634  self.assertIsInstance(output[1][1], torch.Tensor)
3635  self.assertIsInstance(output[1][2], list)
3636  self.assertIsInstance(output[1][2][0], torch.Tensor)
3637  self.assertIsInstance(output[2], torch.Tensor)
3638  self.assertIsInstance(output[3], dict)
3639  self.assertEqual(len(output[3]), 2)
3640  self.assertIn('a', output[3])
3641  self.assertIn('b', output[3])
3642  self.assertIsInstance(output[3]['a'], torch.Tensor)
3643  self.assertIsInstance(output[3]['b'], list)
3644  self.assertIsInstance(output[3]['b'][0], torch.Tensor)
3645 
3646  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3647  def test_data_parallel_nested_input(self):
3648  def fn(input):
3649  return input[1][0]
3650 
3651  class Net(nn.Module):
3652  def forward(self, *input):
3653  return fn(input)
3654 
3655  i = Variable(torch.randn(20, 3).float().cuda(1))
3656  input = (i.cos(), (i.sin(), i), i.sin())
3657  gpus = range(torch.cuda.device_count())
3658  output = dp.data_parallel(Net(), input, gpus)
3659  self.assertEqual(output, fn(input))
3660 
3661  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
3662  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
3663  def test_data_parallel_module(self, dtype=torch.float):
3664  l = nn.Linear(10, 5).to("cuda", dtype)
3665  i = torch.randn(20, 10, device="cuda", dtype=dtype)
3666  expected_out = l(i).data
3667  net = nn.DataParallel(l)
3668  out = net(i)
3669  self.assertEqual(out.get_device(), 0)
3670  self.assertEqual(out.data, expected_out, dtype2prec[dtype])
3671 
3672  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
3673  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
3674  def test_data_parallel_module_kwargs_only(self, dtype=torch.float):
3675  class Net(nn.Module):
3676  def __init__(self):
3677  super(Net, self).__init__()
3678  self.l = l
3679 
3680  def forward(self, input):
3681  return self.l(input)
3682 
3683  l = nn.Linear(10, 5).to("cuda", dtype)
3684  i = torch.randn(20, 10, device="cuda", dtype=dtype)
3685  expected_out = l(i).data
3686  n = nn.DataParallel(Net())
3687  out = n(input=i)
3688  self.assertEqual(out.get_device(), 0)
3689  self.assertEqual(out.data, expected_out, dtype2prec[dtype])
3690 
3691  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
3692  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
3693  def test_data_parallel_module_kwargs_only_empty_list(self, dtype=torch.float):
3694  class Net(nn.Module):
3695  def __init__(self):
3696  super(Net, self).__init__()
3697  self.l = l
3698 
3699  def forward(self, input):
3700  return self.l(input['data'])
3701 
3702  l = nn.Linear(10, 5).to("cuda", dtype)
3703  i = torch.randn(20, 10, device="cuda", dtype=dtype)
3704  expected_out = l(i).data
3705  n = nn.DataParallel(Net())
3706  out = n(input={'data': i, 'unused': []})
3707  self.assertEqual(out.get_device(), 0)
3708  self.assertEqual(out.data, expected_out, dtype2prec[dtype])
3709 
3710  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
3711  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
3712  def test_data_parallel_module_kwargs_only_empty_dict(self, dtype=torch.float):
3713  class Net(nn.Module):
3714  def __init__(self):
3715  super(Net, self).__init__()
3716  self.l = l
3717 
3718  def forward(self, input):
3719  return self.l(input['data'])
3720 
3721  l = nn.Linear(10, 5).to("cuda", dtype)
3722  i = torch.randn(20, 10, device="cuda", dtype=dtype)
3723  expected_out = l(i).data
3724  n = nn.DataParallel(Net())
3725  out = n(input={'data': i, 'unused': {}})
3726  self.assertEqual(out.get_device(), 0)
3727  self.assertEqual(out.data, expected_out, dtype2prec[dtype])
3728 
3729  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, "CUDA unavailable")
3730  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
3731  def test_data_parallel_module_kwargs_only_empty_tuple(self, dtype=torch.float):
3732  class Net(nn.Module):
3733  def __init__(self):
3734  super(Net, self).__init__()
3735  self.l = l
3736 
3737  def forward(self, input):
3738  return self.l(input['data'])
3739 
3740  l = nn.Linear(10, 5).to("cuda", dtype)
3741  i = torch.randn(20, 10, device="cuda", dtype=dtype)
3742  expected_out = l(i).data
3743  n = nn.DataParallel(Net())
3744  out = n(input={'data': i, 'unused': ()})
3745  self.assertEqual(out.get_device(), 0)
3746  self.assertEqual(out.data, expected_out, dtype2prec[dtype])
3747 
3748  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_MULTIGPU, "multi-GPU not supported")
3749  def test_data_parallel_device_args(self):
3750  cuda0 = torch.device('cuda:0')
3751  cuda1 = torch.device('cuda:1')
3752 
3753  # test output_device
3754  l = nn.Linear(10, 5).to(cuda0, torch.float)
3755  i = torch.randn(20, 10, dtype=torch.float, device=cuda0, requires_grad=True)
3756  out = dp.data_parallel(l, i, device_ids=(0, 1), output_device=cuda0)
3757  self.assertEqual(out, l(i))
3758 
3759  # test device_ids
3760  l = nn.Linear(10, 5).to(cuda0, torch.float)
3761  i = torch.randn(20, 10, dtype=torch.float, device=cuda0, requires_grad=True)
3762  out = dp.data_parallel(l, i, device_ids=(cuda0, cuda1), output_device=cuda0)
3763  self.assertEqual(out, l(i))
3764 
3765  def test_state_dict(self):
3766  l = nn.Linear(5, 5)
3767  block = nn.Module()
3768  block.conv = nn.Conv2d(3, 3, 3, bias=False)
3769  net = nn.Module()
3770  net.linear1 = l
3771  net.linear2 = l
3772  net.bn = nn.BatchNorm2d(2)
3773  net.block = block
3774  net.add_module('empty', None)
3775 
3776  state_dict = net.state_dict()
3777  self.assertEqual(len(state_dict), 10)
3778  self.assertEqual(len(state_dict._metadata), 6)
3779  self.assertIn('', state_dict._metadata)
3780  self.assertIn('linear1', state_dict._metadata)
3781  self.assertIn('linear1.weight', state_dict)
3782  self.assertIn('linear1.bias', state_dict)
3783  self.assertIn('linear2', state_dict._metadata)
3784  self.assertIn('linear2.weight', state_dict)
3785  self.assertIn('linear2.bias', state_dict)
3786  self.assertIn('block', state_dict._metadata)
3787  self.assertIn('block.conv', state_dict._metadata)
3788  self.assertIn('block.conv.weight', state_dict)
3789  self.assertIn('block.conv.weight', state_dict)
3790  self.assertNotIn('block.conv.bias', state_dict)
3791  self.assertIn('bn', state_dict._metadata)
3792  self.assertIn('bn.weight', state_dict)
3793  self.assertIn('bn.bias', state_dict)
3794  self.assertIn('bn.running_var', state_dict)
3795  self.assertIn('bn.running_mean', state_dict)
3796  self.assertIn('bn.num_batches_tracked', state_dict)
3797  self.assertFalse(any(map(lambda k: k.startswith('empty'), state_dict.keys())))
3798  for k, v in state_dict.items():
3799  param = net
3800  for component in k.split('.'):
3801  param = getattr(param, component)
3802  if isinstance(param, Parameter):
3803  param = param.data
3804  self.assertEqual(v.data_ptr(), param.data_ptr())
3805 
3806  l = nn.Linear(5, 5)
3807  state_dict = l.state_dict()
3808  self.assertEqual(len(state_dict), 2)
3809  self.assertEqual(len(state_dict._metadata), 1)
3810  self.assertIn('', state_dict._metadata)
3811  self.assertTrue(state_dict._metadata['']['version'] >= 0)
3812  self.assertEqual(state_dict['weight'].data_ptr(), l.weight.data_ptr())
3813  self.assertEqual(state_dict['bias'].data_ptr(), l.bias.data_ptr())
3814 
3815  def test_load_state_dict(self):
3816  l = nn.Linear(5, 5)
3817  block = nn.Module()
3818  block.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(3, 3, 3, bias=True)
3819  block.conv2 = nn.Conv2d(3, 3, 3, bias=False)
3820  net = nn.Module()
3821  net.linear1 = l
3822  net.linear2 = l
3823  net.bn = nn.BatchNorm2d(2)
3824  net.block = block
3825  net.add_module('empty', None)
3826 
3827  state_dict = net.state_dict()
3828  state_dict.update({
3829  'linear1.weight': torch.ones(5, 5),
3830  'block.conv1.bias': torch.arange(1, 4),
3831  'bn.running_mean': torch.randn(2),
3832  })
3833  net.load_state_dict(state_dict)
3834  self.assertEqual(net.linear1.weight.data, state_dict['linear1.weight'])
3835  self.assertEqual(net.block.conv1.bias.data, state_dict['block.conv1.bias'])
3836  self.assertEqual(net.bn.running_mean, state_dict['bn.running_mean'])
3837 
3838  state_dict = net.state_dict()
3839  state_dict.update({'extra': torch.ones(5)})
3840  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: net.load_state_dict(state_dict))
3841 
3842  state_dict = net.state_dict()
3843  state_dict.update({'extra.param': torch.ones(5)})
3844  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: net.load_state_dict(state_dict))
3845 
3846  state_dict = net.state_dict()
3847  del state_dict['linear1.weight']
3848  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: net.load_state_dict(state_dict))
3849 
3850  state_dict = net.state_dict()
3851  state_dict.update({'bn.running_mean': torch.rand(14, 4)}) # wrong size
3852  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: net.load_state_dict(state_dict))
3853 
3854  state_dict = net.state_dict()
3855  old_state_dict = deepcopy(state_dict)
3856  state_dict = {
3857  'linear1.weight': torch.ones(5, 5),
3858  'block.conv1.bias': torch.arange(1, 4),
3859  'bn.running_mean': torch.randn(2),
3860  'nonexistent_key': torch.rand(3)
3861  }
3862  net.load_state_dict(state_dict, strict=False)
3863  self.assertEqual(net.linear1.weight.data, state_dict['linear1.weight'])
3864  self.assertEqual(net.block.conv1.bias.data, state_dict['block.conv1.bias'])
3865  self.assertEqual(net.bn.running_mean, state_dict['bn.running_mean'])
3866  new_state_dict = net.state_dict()
3867  del old_state_dict['linear1.weight']
3868  del old_state_dict['block.conv1.bias']
3869  del old_state_dict['bn.running_mean']
3870  for k, v, in old_state_dict.items():
3871  self.assertTrue(v.equal(new_state_dict[k]))
3872 
3873  def test_load_state_dict_BC(self):
3874  # BatchNormNd
3875  # Added num_batches_tracked buffer at version 2. For state dict with
3876  # earlier versions or no versions, it should provide default value of 0.
3877  bn = nn.BatchNorm2d(3)
3878  state_dict = bn.state_dict()
3879  del state_dict['num_batches_tracked']
3880  state_dict._metadata['']['version'] = 1 # version 1
3881  bn.load_state_dict(state_dict)
3882  self.assertEqual(bn.num_batches_tracked.dtype, torch.long)
3883  self.assertEqual(bn.num_batches_tracked.item(), 0)
3884  del state_dict._metadata['']['version'] # no version
3885  bn.load_state_dict(state_dict)
3886  self.assertEqual(bn.num_batches_tracked.dtype, torch.long)
3887  self.assertEqual(bn.num_batches_tracked.item(), 0)
3888 
3889  def test_parameter_assignment(self):
3890  l = nn.Linear(5, 5)
3891 
3892  def num_params():
3893  return len(list(l.parameters()))
3894 
3895  self.assertEqual(num_params(), 2)
3896 
3897  new_param = Parameter(torch.randn(5, 5))
3898  l.param_name = new_param
3899  self.assertEqual(num_params(), 3)
3900  self.assertObjectIn(new_param, l.parameters())
3901 
3902  var = torch.randn(5, 5)
3903  l.var_name = var
3904  self.assertEqual(num_params(), 3)
3905  self.assertNotIn(id(var), map(id, l.parameters()))
3906 
3907  # Make sure Variables are not saved as parameters
3908  l.variable_attr = torch.empty(5, 5)
3909  self.assertEqual(num_params(), 3)
3910  l.param_attr = Parameter(torch.empty(5, 5))
3911  self.assertEqual(num_params(), 4)
3912 
3913  # It shouldn't be possible to replace a parameter with a Variable
3914  def assign_var():
3915  l.param_attr = torch.empty(5, 5)
3916 
3917  self.assertRaises(TypeError, assign_var)
3918  # But replacing it with None should be fine
3919  l.param_attr = None
3920  self.assertEqual(num_params(), 3)
3921 
3922  def test_assignment(self):
3923  l = nn.Module()
3924  a = nn.Parameter(torch.randn(2))
3925  b = nn.Parameter(torch.randn(3))
3926  c = nn.Parameter(torch.randn(4))
3927  q = nn.Linear(4, 4)
3928  r = nn.Linear(5, 5)
3929  w = nn.Linear(6, 6)
3930 
3931  def test_assignments(get_list, a, b, c):
3932  # Check that None can be shadowed
3933  l.a = None
3934  self.assertIsNone(l.a)
3935  self.assertIn('a', l.__dict__)
3936  l.a = a
3937  self.assertIs(l.a, a)
3938  self.assertEqual(get_list(), [a])
3939  self.assertNotIn('a', l.__dict__)
3940 
3941  # Assign second object
3942  l.b = None
3943  self.assertIsNone(l.b)
3944  self.assertIn('b', l.__dict__)
3945  l.b = b
3946  self.assertIs(l.b, b)
3947  self.assertEqual(get_list(), [a, b])
3948  self.assertNotIn('b', l.__dict__)
3949 
3950  # Remove and add the object back. Order should be unchanged.
3951  l.a = None
3952  self.assertIsNone(l.a)
3953  self.assertEqual(get_list(), [b])
3954  l.a = a
3955  self.assertIs(l.a, a)
3956  self.assertEqual(get_list(), [a, b])
3957 
3958  # Replace object with another one. Order should be unchanged.
3959  l.a = c
3960  self.assertIs(l.a, c)
3961  self.assertEqual(get_list(), [c, b])
3962 
3963  # Remove and reassign an attribute. It should appear at the end of the list now.
3964  del l.a
3965  self.assertFalse(hasattr(l, 'a'))
3966  l.a = a
3967  self.assertIs(l.a, a)
3968  self.assertEqual(get_list(), [b, a])
3969 
3970  test_assignments(lambda: list(l.parameters()), a, b, c)
3971  del l.a, l.b
3972  self.assertEqual(list(l.parameters()), [])
3973 
3974  test_assignments(lambda: list(l.children()), q, r, w)
3975  del l.a, l.b
3976  self.assertEqual(list(l.children()), [])
3977 
3978  buf = torch.randn(10)
3979  l.register_buffer('buf', buf)
3980  self.assertIs(l.buf, buf)
3981  l.buf = None
3982  self.assertIs(l.buf, None)
3983  self.assertNotIn('buf', l.__dict__) # should be stored in l._buffers
3984  l.buf = buf
3985  self.assertIn('buf', l.state_dict())
3986  self.assertEqual(l.state_dict()['buf'], buf)
3987 
3988  def test_Conv2d_inconsistent_types(self):
3989  inputs = Variable(torch.randn(4, 1, 7, 7).float())
3990  weights = Variable(torch.randn(1, 1, 3, 3).double())
3991  # inconsistent types should raise an exception
3992  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: nn.functional.conv2d(inputs, weights))
3993  # but it should work with the same type
3994  nn.functional.conv2d(inputs.float(), weights.float())
3995 
3996  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, 'CUDA not available')
3997  def test_Conv2d_inconsistent_types_on_GPU_without_cudnn(self):
3998  inputs = Variable(torch.randn(4, 1, 7, 7).float().cuda())
3999  weights = Variable(torch.randn(1, 1, 3, 3).double().cuda())
4000  bias = Variable(torch.randn(1).double().cuda())
4001 
4002  with torch.backends.cudnn.flags(enabled=False):
4003  # inconsistent types should raise an exception
4004  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: nn.functional.conv2d(inputs, weights))
4005  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: nn.functional.conv2d(inputs, weights.float(), bias))
4006 
4007  # but it should work with the same type
4008  nn.functional.conv2d(inputs.float(), weights.float(), bias.float())
4009 
4010  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, 'CUDA not available')
4011  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDNN, 'CUDNN not available')
4012  def test_Conv2d_inconsistent_types_on_GPU_with_cudnn(self):
4013  inputs = Variable(torch.randn(4, 1, 7, 7).float().cuda())
4014  weights = Variable(torch.randn(1, 1, 3, 3).double().cuda())
4015  bias = Variable(torch.randn(1).double().cuda())
4016 
4017  with torch.backends.cudnn.flags(enabled=True):
4018  # inconsistent types should raise an exception
4019  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: nn.functional.conv2d(inputs, weights))
4020  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: nn.functional.conv2d(inputs, weights.float(), bias))
4021 
4022  # but it should work with the same type
4023  nn.functional.conv2d(inputs.float(), weights.float(), bias.float())
4024 
4025  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, 'CUDA not available')
4026  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDNN, 'CUDNN not available')
4027  @skipIfRocm
4028  def test_cudnn_multiple_threads_same_device(self):
4029  # This function is intended to test the lazy creation and reuse of per-thread
4030  # cudnn handles on each device in aten/src/ATen/cudnn/Handles.cpp.
4031  # Failure here likely indicates something wrong with that logic.
4032  weight = torch.ones((1, 1, 2, 2), device='cuda')
4033 
4034  results = {}
4035 
4036  num_threads = 2
4037  trials = 2
4038  test_iters = 100
4039 
4040  with torch.backends.cudnn.flags(enabled=True):
4041  def _worker(t, input):
4042  my_stream = torch.cuda.Stream()
4043  results[t] = input
4044  with torch.cuda.stream(my_stream):
4045  for _ in range(test_iters):
4046  # If all threads are sharing the same cudnn handle,
4047  # the following sequence may occur:
4048  # thread 0 calls setCuDNNStreamToCurrent()
4049  # thread 1 calls setCuDNNStreamToCurrent()
4050  # thread 0 launches its raw convolution, which it thinks is in
4051  # its own stream, but is actually in thread 1's stream.
4052  # thread 0 enqueues its div_, which IS is its own stream,
4053  # but now races with its convolution.
4054  results[t] = torch.nn.functional.conv2d(results[t], weight, padding=0)
4055  results[t].div_(4.0)
4056  torch.cuda.current_stream().wait_stream(my_stream)
4057 
4058  for _ in range(trials):
4059  for t in range(num_threads):
4060  results[t] = torch.ones((1, 1, 2048, 2048), device='cuda')
4061 
4062  threads = [threading.Thread(target=_worker,
4063  args=(t, results[t])) for t in range(num_threads)]
4064 
4065  for thread in threads:
4066  thread.start()
4067  for thread in threads:
4068  thread.join()
4069 
4070  for t in range(num_threads):
4071  self.assertEqual(results[t].sum().item(),
4072  (2048 - test_iters) * (2048 - test_iters))
4073 
4074  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, 'CUDA not available')
4075  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDNN, 'CUDNN not available')
4076  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
4077  def test_Conv2d_deterministic_cudnn(self, dtype=torch.float):
4078  inputs = torch.randn(2, 3, 5, 5, device="cuda", dtype=dtype, requires_grad=True)
4079  with cudnn.flags(enabled=True, benchmark=True, deterministic=True):
4080  conv1 = torch.nn.Conv2d(3, 3, 3).to("cuda", dtype)
4081  conv2 = torch.nn.Conv2d(3, 3, 3).to("cuda", dtype)
4082  conv2.bias.data.copy_(conv1.bias.data)
4083  conv2.weight.data.copy_(conv1.weight.data)
4084  out1 = conv1(inputs)
4085  out2 = conv2(inputs)
4086  self.assertEqual(out1, out2, prec=0.0)
4087  y = torch.randn(out1.size(), device="cuda", dtype=dtype)
4088  out1.backward(y)
4089  out2.backward(y)
4090  self.assertEqual(conv1.bias.grad.data, conv2.bias.grad.data, prec=0.0)
4091  self.assertEqual(conv1.weight.grad.data, conv2.weight.grad.data, prec=0.0)
4092 
4093  def test_Conv2d_missing_argument(self):
4094  c = nn.Conv2d(3, 3, 3)
4095  self.assertRaises(TypeError, lambda: c(None))
4096 
4097  def test_Conv2d_backward_twice(self):
4098  input = torch.randn(2, 3, 5, 5)
4099  c = nn.Conv2d(3, 3, 3)
4100  o1 = c(input)
4101  o1.sum().backward()
4102  self.assertRaisesRegex(RuntimeError, 'Specify retain_graph=True',
4103  lambda: o1.sum().backward())
4104 
4105  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, 'CUDA not available')
4106  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
4107  def test_Conv2d_large_workspace(self, dtype=torch.float):
4108  # These sizes require huge cuDNN workspaces. Make sure we choose a
4109  # reasonable algorithm that does not run out of memory
4110  sizes = [
4111  (1, 256, 109, 175),
4112  (1, 256, 80, 128),
4113  (1, 256, 120, 192),
4114  ]
4115 
4116  def run_test(benchmark):
4117  with torch.backends.cudnn.flags(benchmark=benchmark):
4118  conv = torch.nn.Conv2d(256, 256, kernel_size=3, padding=1).to("cuda", dtype)
4119  for size in sizes:
4120  x = torch.randn(size, device="cuda", dtype=dtype)
4121  out = conv(x.detach().clone().requires_grad_())
4122  out.backward(torch.ones_like(out))
4123 
4124  run_test(benchmark=False)
4125  run_test(benchmark=True)
4126 
4127  def test_conv_modules_raise_error_on_incorrect_input_size(self):
4128  modules = [nn.Conv1d(3, 8, 3), nn.ConvTranspose1d(3, 8, 3),
4129  nn.Conv2d(3, 8, 3), nn.ConvTranspose2d(3, 8, 3),
4130  nn.Conv3d(3, 8, 3), nn.ConvTranspose3d(3, 8, 3)]
4131 
4132  invalid_input_dims = [(2, 4), (2, 4),
4133  (3, 5), (3, 5),
4134  (4, 6), (4, 6)]
4135 
4136  for invalid_dims, module in zip(invalid_input_dims, modules):
4137  for dims in invalid_dims:
4138  input = torch.empty(torch.Size((3, ) * dims))
4139  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: module(input))
4140 
4141  def test_conv_shapecheck(self):
4142  def test(should_raise, module, input_size):
4143  input = torch.empty(3, *input_size)
4144  if should_raise:
4145  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: module(input))
4146  else:
4147  # just run it to ensure no exception raised.
4148  module(input)
4149 
4150  # Conv1d
4151  test(True, nn.Conv1d(1, 1, 3), (1, 2))
4152  test(True, nn.Conv1d(1, 1, 3, stride=2), (1, 2))
4153  test(False, nn.Conv1d(1, 1, 2), (1, 2))
4154  test(False, nn.Conv1d(1, 1, 2, stride=2), (1, 2))
4155  test(False, nn.Conv1d(1, 1, 3, stride=2, padding=1), (1, 2))
4156 
4157  # Conv2d
4158  test(True, nn.Conv2d(1, 1, (3, 3)), (1, 2, 2))
4159  test(False, nn.Conv2d(1, 1, (3, 3)), (1, 3, 3))
4160  test(False, nn.Conv2d(1, 1, (3, 3), padding=1), (1, 2, 2))
4161 
4162  # Conv3D
4163  test(True, nn.Conv3d(1, 1, (3, 3, 3)), (1, 2, 2, 2))
4164  test(False, nn.Conv3d(1, 1, (3, 3, 3)), (1, 3, 3, 3))
4165  test(False, nn.Conv3d(1, 1, (3, 3, 3), padding=1), (1, 2, 2, 2))
4166 
4167  def test_ConvTranspose2d_output_size(self):
4168  m = nn.ConvTranspose2d(3, 4, 3, 3, 0, 2)
4169  i = torch.randn(2, 3, 6, 6)
4170  for h in range(15, 22):
4171  for w in range(15, 22):
4172  if 18 <= h <= 20 and 18 <= w <= 20:
4173  output = m(i, output_size=(h, w))
4174  self.assertEqual(output.size()[2:], (h, w))
4175  else:
4176  self.assertRaises(ValueError, lambda: m(i, (h, w)))
4177 
4178  def test_ConvTranspose3d_correct_output_size(self):
4179  # Check that ConvTranspose3d can take a 5d output_size.
4180  m = nn.ConvTranspose3d(2, 2, 2)
4181  i = torch.rand(1, 2, 1, 1, 1)
4182  out = m(i, output_size=(1, 2, 2, 2, 2))
4183 
4184  def _test_Conv2d_naive_groups(self, device="cpu", dtype=torch.float):
4185  # Check that grouped convolutions matches two half convolutions
4186  m = nn.Conv2d(4, 4, kernel_size=3, groups=2).to(device, dtype)
4187  i = torch.randn(2, 4, 6, 6, device=device, dtype=dtype, requires_grad=True)
4188  output = m(i)
4189  grad_output = torch.randn(2, 4, 4, 4, device=device, dtype=dtype)
4190  output.backward(grad_output)
4191 
4192  m1 = nn.Conv2d(2, 2, kernel_size=3).to(device, dtype)
4193  m1.weight.data.copy_(m.weight.data[:2])
4194  m1.bias.data.copy_(m.bias.data[:2])
4195  i1 = Variable(i.data[:, :2].contiguous(), requires_grad=True)
4196  output1 = m1(i1)
4197  output1.backward(grad_output[:, :2].contiguous())
4198 
4199  m2 = nn.Conv2d(2, 2, kernel_size=3).to(device, dtype)
4200  m2.weight.data.copy_(m.weight.data[2:])
4201  m2.bias.data.copy_(m.bias.data[2:])
4202  i2 = Variable(i.data[:, 2:].contiguous(), requires_grad=True)
4203  output2 = m2(i2)
4204  output2.backward(grad_output[:, 2:].contiguous())
4205 
4206  self.assertEqual(output, torch.cat([output1, output2], 1))
4207  self.assertEqual(i.grad.data,
4208  torch.cat([i1.grad.data, i2.grad.data], 1),
4209  prec=dtype2prec[dtype])
4210  self.assertEqual(m.bias.grad.data,
4211  torch.cat([m1.bias.grad.data, m2.bias.grad.data], 0),
4212  prec=dtype2prec[dtype])
4213  self.assertEqual(m.weight.grad.data,
4214  torch.cat([m1.weight.grad.data, m2.weight.grad.data], 0),
4215  prec=dtype2prec[dtype])
4216 
4217  # For https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/1273
4218  # Almost identical to the above `test_Conv2d_naive_groups`
4219  def test_Conv2d_groups_nobias(self):
4220  dev_dtypes = [("cpu", torch.float)]
4221  if TEST_CUDA:
4222  dev_dtypes += [("cuda", torch.float), ("cuda", torch.half)]
4223  for device, dtype in dev_dtypes:
4224  m = nn.Conv2d(4, 4, kernel_size=3, groups=2, bias=False).to(device, dtype)
4225  i = torch.randn(2, 4, 6, 6, device=device, dtype=dtype, requires_grad=True)
4226  output = m(i)
4227  grad_output = torch.randn(2, 4, 4, 4, device=device, dtype=dtype)
4228  output.backward(grad_output)
4229 
4230  m1 = nn.Conv2d(2, 2, kernel_size=3, bias=False).to(device, dtype)
4231  m1.weight.data.copy_(m.weight.data[:2])
4232  i1 = Variable(i.data[:, :2].contiguous(), requires_grad=True)
4233  output1 = m1(i1)
4234  output1.backward(grad_output[:, :2].contiguous())
4235 
4236  m2 = nn.Conv2d(2, 2, kernel_size=3, bias=False).to(device, dtype)
4237  m2.weight.data.copy_(m.weight.data[2:])
4238  i2 = Variable(i.data[:, 2:].contiguous(), requires_grad=True)
4239  output2 = m2(i2)
4240  output2.backward(grad_output[:, 2:].contiguous())
4241 
4242  self.assertEqual(output, torch.cat([output1, output2], 1))
4243  self.assertEqual(i.grad.data,
4244  torch.cat([i1.grad.data, i2.grad.data], 1),
4245  dtype2prec[dtype])
4246  self.assertEqual(m.weight.grad.data,
4247  torch.cat([m1.weight.grad.data, m2.weight.grad.data], 0),
4248  1e-1 if dtype == torch.half else dtype2prec[dtype])
4249 
4250  # Very similar to test_Conv2d_naive_groups but with special care to handle
4251  # the number of groups == number of input channels
4252  @unittest.skipIf(not TEST_CUDA, 'CUDA not available')
4253  @skipIfRocm
4254  @repeat_test_for_types(ALL_TENSORTYPES)
4255  def test_Conv2d_depthwise_naive_groups_cuda(self, dtype=torch.float):
4256  for depth_multiplier in [1, 2]:
4257  m = nn.Conv2d(2, 2 * depth_multiplier, kernel_size=3, groups=2).to("cuda", dtype)
4258  i = torch.randn(2, 2, 6, 6, device="cuda", dtype=dtype).div_(2).requires_grad_()
4259  output = m(i)
4260  grad_output = torch.randn(2, 2 * depth_multiplier, 4, 4, device="cuda", dtype=dtype) / 2
4261  output.backward(grad_output)
4262 
4263  offset = 1 * depth_multiplier
4264 
4265  m1 = nn.Conv2d(1, 1 * depth_multiplier, kernel_size=3).to("cuda", dtype)
4266  m1.weight.data = m.weight.data[:offset].clone()
4267  m1.bias.data = m.bias.data[:offset].clone()
4268  i1 = i.detach()[:, :1].clone().requires_grad_()
4269  output1 = m1(i1)
4270  output1.backward(grad_output[:, :offset].contiguous())
4271 
4272  m2 = nn.Conv2d(1, 1 * depth_multiplier, kernel_size=3).to("cuda", dtype)
4273  m2.weight.data.copy_(m.weight.data[offset:])
4274  m2.bias.data.copy_(m.bias.data[offset:])
4275  i2 = i.detach()[:, 1:].clone().requires_grad_()
4276  output2 = m2(i2)
4277  output2.backward(grad_output[:, offset:].contiguous())
4278 
4279  self.assertEqual(output, torch.cat([output1, output2], 1),
4280  prec=dtype2prec[dtype])
4281  self.assertEqual(i.grad.data,
4282  torch.cat([i1.grad.data, i2.grad.data], 1),
4283  prec=dtype2prec[dtype])
4284  self.assertEqual(m.bias.grad.data,
4285  torch.cat([m1.bias.grad.data,
4286  m2.bias.grad.data], 0),
4287  prec=dtype2prec[dtype])
4288  self.assertEqual(m.weight.grad.data,
4289  torch.cat([m1.weight.grad.data,
4290  m2.weight.grad.data], 0),
4291  prec=dtype2prec[dtype])
4292 
4293  def test_MaxUnpool2d_output_size(self):
4294  m = nn.MaxPool2d(3, stride=2, return_indices=True)
4295  mu = nn.MaxUnpool2d(3, stride=2)
4296  big_t = torch.rand(1, 1, 6, 6)
4297  big_t[0][0][4][4] = 100
4298  output_big, indices_big = m(big_t)
4299  self.assertRaises(RuntimeError, lambda: mu(output_big, indices_big))
4300 
4301  small_t = torch.rand(1, 1, 5, 5)
4302  for i in range(0, 4, 2):
4303  for j in range(0, 4, 2):
4304  small_t[:, :, i, j] = 100
4305  output_small, indices_small = m(Variable(small_t))
4306  for h in range(3, 10):
4307  for w in range(3, 10):
4308  if 4 <= h <= 6 and 4 <= w <= 6:
4309  size = (h, w)
4310  if h == 6:
4311  size = (1, 1) + size
4312 
4313  mu(output_small, indices_small, output_size=size)
4314  else:
4315  self.assertRaises(ValueError, lambda: mu(output_small, indices_small, (h, w)))
4316 
4317  def test_container_copy(self):
4318  class Model(nn.Module):
4319  def __init__(self):
4320  super(Model, self).__init__()
4321  self.linear = nn.Linear(4, 5)
4322 
4323  def forward(self, input):
4324  return self.linear(input)
4325 
4326  input = torch.randn(2, 4)
4327 
4328  model = Model()
4329  model_cp = deepcopy(model)
4330  self.assertEqual(model(input).data, model_cp(input).data)
4331 
4332  model_cp.linear.weight.data[:] = 2
4333  self.assertNotEqual(model(input).data, model_cp(input).data)
4334 
4335  def test_RNN_cell(self):
4336  # this is just a smoke test; these modules are implemented through
4337  # autograd so no Jacobian test is needed
4338  for module in (nn.RNNCell, nn.GRUCell):
4339  for bias in (True, False):
4340  input = torch.randn(3, 10)
4341  hx = torch.randn(3, 20)
4342  cell = module(10, 20, bias=bias)
4343  for _ in range(6):
4344  hx = cell(input, hx)
4345 
4346  hx.sum().backward()
4347 
4348  def _test_loss_equal_input_target_shape(self, cast):
4349  # Tests losses whose inputs should have the same size.
4350  losses = {
4351  'mse_loss': lambda x, y: F.mse_loss(x, y),
4352  'l1_loss': lambda x, y: F.l1_loss(x, y),
4353  'smooth_l1_loss': lambda x, y: F.smooth_l1_loss(x, y),
4354  'kl_div': lambda x, y: F.kl_div(x, y),
4355  'poisson_nll_loss': lambda x, y: F.poisson_nll_loss(x, y),
4356  }
4357 
4358  input = Variable(cast(torch.randn(3, 5)))
4359  target = Variable(cast(torch.randn(5, 3)))
4360  for _name, fn in losses.items():
4361  self.assertRaises(Exception, lambda: fn(input, target))
4362 
4363  def test_loss_equal_input_target_shape(self):
4364  self._test_loss_equal_input_target_shape(lambda x: x)
4365 
4366  def test_nll_loss_mismatched_batch(self):
4367  x = torch.randn((10, 3), requires_grad=True)
4368  # t should have size (10,)
4369  t = torch.zeros((3,), dtype=torch.int64)
4370  with self.assertRaisesRegex(ValueError, 'Expected.*batch_size'):
4371  F.nll_loss(x, t)
4372 
4373  def test_nll_loss_out_of_bounds_ignore_index(self):
4374  x = torch.randn(6, 3, requires_grad=True)
4375  t = torch.tensor([0, 1, 255, 0, 1, 2], dtype=torch.int64)
4376  for reduction in ['mean', 'none']:
4377  F.nll_loss(x, t, ignore_index=255, reduction=reduction).sum().backward()
4378 
4379  def test_poisson_nll_loss_reduction_modes(self):
4380  input = torch.tensor([0.5, 1.5, 2.5])
4381  target = torch.tensor([1., 2., 3.])
4382  component_wise_loss = torch.exp(input) - target * input
4383  self.assertEqual(component_wise_loss,
4384  F.poisson_nll_loss(input, target, reduction='none'))
4385  self.assertEqual(torch.sum(component_wise_loss),
4386  F.poisson_nll_loss(input, target, reduction='sum'))
4387  self.assertEqual(torch.mean(component_wise_loss),
4388  F.poisson_nll_loss(input, target, reduction='mean'))
4389  with self.assertRaisesRegex(ValueError, 'is not valid'):
4390  F.poisson_nll_loss(input, target, reduction='total')
4391 
4392  def test_KLDivLoss_batch_mean(self):
4393  input_shape = (2, 5)
4394  log_prob1 = F.log_softmax(torch.randn(input_shape), 1)
4395  prob2 = F.softmax(torch.randn(input_shape), 1)
4396 
4397  loss = nn.KLDivLoss(reduction='batchmean')
4398  l = loss(log_prob1, prob2)
4399 
4400  loss_none_reduce = nn.KLDivLoss(reduction='sum')(log_prob1, prob2)
4401  expected = loss_none_reduce / input_shape[0]
4402 
4403  self.assertEqual(l, expected)
4404 
4405  @unittest.skipIf(not (TEST_CUDNN and TEST_CUDNN_VERSION >= 7000), "needs cudnn >= 7.0")
4406  def test_CTCLoss_cudnn(self):
4407  target_lengths = [30, 25, 20]
4408  input_lengths = [50, 50, 50]
